original: shes dang shes bya'i dngos po kun //
analyzed: shes dang shes bya'i dngos po kun //

original: legs par byas shing yang dag thos //
analyzed: legs par byas shing yang dag thos //

original: theg gsum lam dang myang 'das la //
analyzed: theg gsum lam dang myang 'das la //
translated: The paths of the three vehicles and nirvana,

original: rab tu gnas 'jug rab gnas pa //
analyzed: rab tu gnas 'jug rab gnas pa //
translated: Well established, engaged, and fully present,

original: kun mkhyen khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: kun mkhyen khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to you, O Omniscient One.

original: zhes yi ge'i tshig rab tu smras pa 'di rnams kyis bstod pa'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mngon par bstod nas 'di skad ces kyang gsol to //

translated: Having praised the Blessed One with these words and verses of praise, he said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: 'di nas gang g'a'i klung brgya stong phrag gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'das nas nub phyogs kyi char kun nas me tog ldan zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gyur pa @45b der bde ba can zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams🔽gang na bcom ldan 'das /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa /🔽dgra bcom pa /

translated: In that buddhafield there is a world system called Sukhāvatī,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /🔽rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas / rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: where there is a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha called Amitābha.

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: He is a blessed one,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: a knower of the world,🔽a steersman who guides beings,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: an unexcelled one,

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo bsgyur ba /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo bsgyur ba /
translated: a teacher of gods and humans,🔽a buddha, a blessed one.

original: lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa tshe dpag tu med pa bzhugs te de chos ston par mdzad pa ni /🔽thog mar dge ba /🔽bar du dge ba /🔽tha mar dge ba /

translated: The Teacher of gods and humans, Amitāyus, is present and teaches the Dharma.🔽[His teachings] are virtuous in the beginning,

original: don bzang po /
analyzed: don bzang po /
translated: virtuous in the middle,🔽and virtuous in the end.🔽They have excellent meaning,

original: tshig 'brul bzang po /
analyzed: tshig 'brul bzang po /
translated: excellent words,

original: ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa /
translated: are unadulterated,

original: yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa /
translated: completely pure,

original: yongs su byang ba'i tshangs par spyod pa /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba'i tshangs par spyod pa /
translated: and completely refined.

original: yang dag par ston par mdzad cing de 'di ltar bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par ston par mdzad cing de 'di ltar bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston par mdzad do //
translated: He teaches the pure life. He is present, living, enduring, teaching the Dharma in this way.

original: rig sngags dang / gsang sngags kyi don gyi spyod pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang / lam gsum gyi spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i lam dang / skyob pa dang / gnas dang / skyabs dang / dpung gnyen dang / bde ba dang /
analyzed: rig sngags dang / gsang sngags kyi don gyi spyod pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang / lam gsum gyi spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i lam dang / skyob pa dang / gnas dang / skyabs dang / dpung gnyen dang / bde ba dang /
translated: The meaning of the knowledge-mantras and secret mantras, the canon of the bodhisattvas, the path to follow, the conduct of the three paths, the protector, the refuge, the defender, the happiness,

original: shin tu mthar thug pa dang / shin tu yongs su mthar gtugs pas sems can thams cad la ston te bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi mdzad pas rjes su gnang nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung dang nye ba 'dir 'ongs te bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med de bcom ldan🔽'das la gnod pa chung ngam /🔽nyam nga ba chung ngam /

original: ldang ba yang ngam /🔽bsnyun mi mnga' ma /
analyzed: ldang ba yang ngam / bsnyun mi mnga' ma /

original: @46a *// bde ba la reg par gnas sam zhes yongs su 'dri bar byed de /
analyzed: @46a *// bde ba la reg par gnas sam zhes yongs su 'dri bar byed de /

original: 'di skad ces kyang gsung ngo //
analyzed: 'di skad ces kyang gsung ngo //

original: gang rnam pa 'di lta bu'i snyigs ma'i dus gang du bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i sku de'ang chos ston par mdzad cing rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i skye bo la lam gsum gyi byang grol dang / lha dang / mi rnams kyi skye ba rnyed par mdzad pa de ni ngo mtshar ro //
analyzed: gang rnam pa 'di lta bu'i snyigs ma'i dus gang du bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i sku de'ang chos ston par mdzad cing rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i skye bo la lam gsum gyi byang grol dang / lha dang / mi rnams kyi skye ba rnyed par mdzad pa de ni ngo mtshar ro //
translated: “It is wonderful how, in this degenerate age, the Blessed One Śākyamuni teaches the Dharma and causes beings to attain the path of liberation through the three vehicles, and to obtain birth as gods and humans.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de'i brtson 'grus kyis gang du skal pa med pa'i sems can gyi tshogs srid pa gsum yang dag par 'joms pa'i lam du mthar thug par 'jug par byed gtan du grub pa dang / bde ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la sems can rnams rab tu 'god par mdzad pa ni ngo mtshar ro //

translated: “It is wonderful how, by his diligence, the Blessed One Śākyamuni causes the multitude of unfortunate beings to enter the path that leads to the destruction of the three worlds, to the ultimate goal, to the attainment of bliss, and to nirvāṇa.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sgrub pa'i don du nye bar tshogs pa rnams la tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang / ka la ping ka dang / ku ta ra dang / bi ta ras bsgrubs pa'i rnga bo che'i dbyangs su grags pa'i sgra dbyangs kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal pa /

translated: To the assembly of bodhisattvas who had gathered for the sake of accomplishing the conduct of bodhisattvas, he spoke with a voice like Brahma's, the sound of a great drum accomplished by Kalapinga, Kutaraka, and Vitara, to the bodhisattva mahasattva noble Avalokitesvara:

original: sems dpa' chen po /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po /
translated: Great being,

original: khyod legs par 'ongs sam /
analyzed: khyod legs par 'ongs sam /
translated: Have you come well?

original: sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa dang / @47a *//
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa dang / @47a *//
translated: The conduct of the great being,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin rlabs sgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad don yang dag par thob par byed pa dang / rig sngags dang / gsang sngags kyi tshig thams cad dang / gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin rlabs sgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad don yang dag par thob par byed pa dang / rig sngags dang / gsang sngags kyi tshig thams cad dang / gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba dang bcas pa dang /
translated: the accomplishment of the blessings of all buddhas, the attainment of the true meaning of all bodhisattvas, all the words of vidya mantras and secret mantras, together with the secret empowerment,

original: phyag rgya dang / dkyil 'khor dang / rtog pa'i dbang bskur ba dang / tshe dang / nad med pa dang / dbang phyug dang / bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sgrub thabs thams cad kyi cho ga'i rgyud dang /
analyzed: phyag rgya dang / dkyil 'khor dang / rtog pa'i dbang bskur ba dang / tshe dang / nad med pa dang / dbang phyug dang / bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sgrub thabs thams cad kyi cho ga'i rgyud dang /
translated: the mudrā, the maṇḍala, the empowerment of the deity, life, health, power, the fulfillment of all wishes, and the tantra of the ritual of all means of achievement.

original: shes pa dang / shes bya dus kyi mthar nub pa dang / rgyal srid dang / zhing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba mdor bsdus pa las /
analyzed: shes pa dang / shes bya dus kyi mthar nub pa dang / rgyal srid dang / zhing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba mdor bsdus pa las /
translated: The knowledge and the object of knowledge will disappear at the end of time, and the kingdom, the past field, the future, and the present will be summarized.

original: sems can thams cad kyis bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / rang gi yon tan 'byung ba; gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i mthar 'jug par byed pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / rang gi yon tan 'byung ba; gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i mthar 'jug par byed pa /
translated: It will fulfill all the wishes of all sentient beings, produce one’s own qualities, and cause one to enter into the practice of mantra.

original: sems can gzhan dga' bar byed pa /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dga' bar byed pa /
translated: It will delight other sentient beings.

original: mi snang ba dang / nam mkhar 'gro bar byed pa /
analyzed: mi snang ba dang / nam mkhar 'gro bar byed pa /
translated: It will make one invisible and enable one to walk on air.

original: rkang pa rab tu brgyus pa /🔽yid gzhungs par byed pa /
analyzed: rkang pa rab tu brgyus pa / yid gzhungs par byed pa /
translated: It will make one’s feet very supple.🔽It will make one’s mind sharp.

original: 'chugs par byed pa /
analyzed: 'chugs par byed pa /
translated: It will cause one to be deceived.

original: sa 'og tu rab tu 'jug par byed pa /
analyzed: sa 'og tu rab tu 'jug par byed pa /
translated: It causes one to enter the underworld.

original: mngon par spyod par byed pa /
analyzed: mngon par spyod par byed pa /
translated: It causes one to engage in the practice.

original: don thams cad thob pa /
analyzed: don thams cad thob pa /
translated: It brings the attainment of all aims.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa /
translated: It is fruitful.

original: gnod sbyin dang gnod sbyin mo dang / ci bgyi dang / sha za dang / 'byung po thams cad 'gugs par byed pa /
analyzed: gnod sbyin dang gnod sbyin mo dang / ci bgyi dang / sha za dang / 'byung po thams cad 'gugs par byed pa /
translated: It summons all yakṣas, yakṣiṇīs, bhūtas, and piśācas.

original: byis pa dang / rgan po dang / lang tsho ji ltar gnas bzhin du gnas par byed pa ste mdor @47b bsdus na las thams cad byed pa /
analyzed: byis pa dang / rgan po dang / lang tsho ji ltar gnas bzhin du gnas par byed pa ste mdor @47b bsdus na las thams cad byed pa /
translated: It causes children, the elderly, and those in their prime to remain as they are. In short, it performs all activities.

original: yid kyi shing rta thams cad rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: yid kyi shing rta thams cad rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: It fulfills all mental wishes.

original: rgyas pa can dang / zhi ba can gyis las rab tu byed pa /
analyzed: rgyas pa can dang / zhi ba can gyis las rab tu byed pa /
translated: It performs the activities of increasing and pacifying.

original: ji lta ji ltar las rab tu sbyar bar bya bzhin pa /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar las rab tu sbyar bar bya bzhin pa /
translated: It is to be applied to activities just as they are to be applied.

original: de lta de ltar bsgrub par bya bzhin pa /
analyzed: de lta de ltar bsgrub par bya bzhin pa /
translated: It is to be accomplished just as it is to be accomplished.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang ldan pa /
translated: It is endowed with the bodhisattva canon.

original: phal po che rtog pa chen po rin po che'i le'u rab 'byams ngas rjes su gnang /
analyzed: phal po che rtog pa chen po rin po che'i le'u rab 'byams ngas rjes su gnang /
translated: I authorize the chapter of the precious great vehicle, the great investigation of the Flower Ornament.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa; dag pa'i sems can rig sngags dang / gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i don /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa; dag pa'i sems can rig sngags dang / gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i don /
translated: mantras, and secret mantras taught by all the buddhas,

original: chos kyi mdzod //
analyzed: chos kyi mdzod //
translated: the treasury of the Dharma,

original: skye bo mang po la phan pa'i ched dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba'i ched du lha dang / mi rnams dang / sems can thams cad la ston cig /
analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan pa'i ched dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba'i ched du lha dang / mi rnams dang / sems can thams cad la ston cig /
translated: should be taught to gods, humans, and all beings for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to many beings.”

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis rlabs kyis kun tu skul bar byed pa rgyan bkod pa'i 'od zer snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis rlabs kyis kun tu skul bar byed pa rgyan bkod pa'i 'od zer snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, through the blessing of the Buddha, entered the samādhi called “the light of the radiance of the array of ornaments that inspires.”

original: snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu dag pa'i sems can du ma gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams 'od zer gyi snang bas ji srid 'og min gyi srid pa nas ji srid mnar med ba'i dmyal ba chen po'i bar gyi sems can gang la la sdug bsngal gyi shin tu gdungs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i

original: gnod sbyin ma chen mo 'di rnams gnod sbyin ma brgya stong phrag du mas yongs su bskor ba de rnams kyang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po der bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la phyag btsal te 'khod par gyur to; ;gang yang sha za mo dag sha za

translated: The piśācīs, surrounded by many hundreds of thousands of piśācīs, also bowed to Lord Śākyamuni in that great assembly and took their seats.

original: mo brgya stong phrag du mas yongs su bskor ba de rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la phyag btsal te 'dus par gyur pa la /
analyzed: mo brgya stong phrag du mas yongs su bskor ba de rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la phyag btsal te 'dus par gyur pa la /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: the goddess of the dice, the goddess of the dust, the fierce flesh-eating goddess, the tāla-leaf flesh-eating goddess, the blazing flesh-eating goddess, the ash-eating goddess, the flesh-eating goddess, the hard-to-grasp goddess,

original: 'khrul byed ma dang / rmongs byed ma dang / sgrogs byed ma dang / skyed byed ma dang / 'jig rten mthar gnas ma dang / thal ba'i mtha' @69a *//
analyzed: 'khrul byed ma dang / rmongs byed ma dang / sgrogs byed ma dang / skyed byed ma dang / 'jig rten mthar gnas ma dang / thal ba'i mtha' @69a *//
translated: the deluding goddess, the confusing goddess, the shouting goddess, the producing goddess, the goddess dwelling at the end of the world, the goddess dwelling at the end of the ashes,

original: can ma dang / 'thung gcod ldan ma dang / mang po ma dang / gdul dka' ma dang / ae la ma dang / mtshan ma can ma dang / du ba'i mtha' can ma dang / du ba ma dang / du ba bzang mo ma zhes pa sha za mo chen mo 'di rnams sha za mo brgya stong phrag du mas yongs su bskor ba rnams kyang 'khor 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po der rab tu zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: can ma dang / 'thung gcod ldan ma dang / mang po ma dang / gdul dka' ma dang / ae la ma dang / mtshan ma can ma dang / du ba'i mtha' can ma dang / du ba ma dang / du ba bzang mo ma zhes pa sha za mo chen mo 'di rnams sha za mo brgya stong phrag du mas yongs su bskor ba rnams kyang 'khor 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po der rab tu zhugs par gyur to //
translated: These great flesh-eating ḍākinīs, surrounded by hundreds of thousands of flesh-eating ḍākinīs, also entered that great assembly of the maṇḍala.

original: gang yang ma mo dang / ma mo chen mo dag 'jig rten gyi rjes su spyod cing sems can la rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa gtor ma dang phreng ba nyid sdud par byed pa la /
analyzed: gang yang ma mo dang / ma mo chen mo dag 'jig rten gyi rjes su spyod cing sems can la rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa gtor ma dang phreng ba nyid sdud par byed pa la /
translated: There were also mātṛkā and great mātṛkā who follow the ways of the world and harm sentient beings, gathering offerings and garlands.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They were:

original: tshangs ma dang / dbang phyug chen mo dang / khyab 'jug ma dang / gzhon nu ma dang / rgan byed ma dang / phag mo dang / dbang mo dang / gshin rje ma dang / me mo dang / nyi ma'i bu mo dang / 'jig rten par ma dang /
analyzed: tshangs ma dang / dbang phyug chen mo dang / khyab 'jug ma dang / gzhon nu ma dang / rgan byed ma dang / phag mo dang / dbang mo dang / gshin rje ma dang / me mo dang / nyi ma'i bu mo dang / 'jig rten par ma dang /
translated: Brahmāṇī, Maheśvarī, Viṣṇu, Kumārī, Vārāhī, Caṇḍī, Vāyu, Yama, Āgneyī, Sūryaputri, Lokapālā,

original: chu lha mo dang / dbang ldan mo dang / rlung lha mo dang / gzhan gyi sreg 'phreg ma dang / zhal rgyan pa mo dang / dge mtshan ma dang / dge mtshan ma chen mo dang / srul mo dang / lus srul me dang /
analyzed: chu lha mo dang / dbang ldan mo dang / rlung lha mo dang / gzhan gyi sreg 'phreg ma dang / zhal rgyan pa mo dang / dge mtshan ma dang / dge mtshan ma chen mo dang / srul mo dang / lus srul me dang /
translated: Varuṇī, Indra, Vāyu, Parjanya, Āryā, Śrī, Mahālakṣmī, Śākinī, Kaivarttī,

original: skem byed ma zhes pa ma mo chen mo 'di rnams ma mo brgya stong phrag du mas yongs su bskor ba de rnams 'khor 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po der /
analyzed: skem byed ma zhes pa ma mo chen mo 'di rnams ma mo brgya stong phrag du mas yongs su bskor ba de rnams 'khor 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po der /
translated: and Kṣetrapālā. These great mātṛkās, surrounded by hundreds of thousands of mātṛkās, were present in the great assembly of the maṇḍala.

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes tshig tu 'don cing 'khod @69b par gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes tshig tu 'don cing 'khod @69b par gyur to //
translated: They all said, “Homage to the Buddha!”

original: de bzhin du mi dang / mi ma yin pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa ji srid dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dang / mi ma yin pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa ji srid dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa nas /
translated: In the same way, there are many hundreds of thousands of humans and non-humans, sentient beings and non-sentient beings, from the great hell of Avīci,

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar skabs 'dir thams cad nam mkha'i dkyil du gsal bar gyur to //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar skabs 'dir thams cad nam mkha'i dkyil du gsal bar gyur to //
translated: In the same way, many hundreds of thousands of humans and non-humans, sentient beings and non-sentient beings, from the great Avīci hell up to the peak of existence, all became visible in the center of space.

original: sems can gyi tshogs kyi srog chags 'ga' la'ang gnod pa med par gyur to //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs kyi srog chags 'ga' la'ang gnod pa med par gyur to //
translated: No harm came to any living being in the assembly of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rgyan gyis sems can thams cad kyis spyi bo na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bzhugs pa yang dag par mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rgyan gyis sems can thams cad kyis spyi bo na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bzhugs pa yang dag par mthong bar gyur to //
translated: By the Buddha's blessing and the adornment of the bodhisattva's magical power, all sentient beings saw with their own eyes the Blessed Buddha and Avalokiteśvara residing on the crown of their heads.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs nas sems dpa' chen po de la bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs nas sems dpa' chen po de la bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One Śākyamuni, looking with his buddha eye at the entire assembly, spoke to that great being:

original: sems can dag gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i don rnam par nges pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u rab 'byams byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod gang da lta de'i dus la bab par shes na shod cig /
analyzed: sems can dag gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i don rnam par nges pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u rab 'byams byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod gang da lta de'i dus la bab par shes na shod cig /
translated: If you know that the time has come to teach the bodhisattva canon, the chapter on the samādhi that determines the meaning of the conduct of the secret mantra for sentient beings, then teach it!”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas rjes su gnang bas nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyis rgyan bkod pa rdo rje sdug cing sra ba'i rgyun zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas rjes su gnang bas nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyis rgyan bkod pa rdo rje sdug cing sra ba'i rgyun zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, with the permission of the Bhagavān Śākyamuni, entered the samādhi called the vajra-stream of beauty and solidity, the array of the adornments of the nature of space.

original: // sems dpa' chen po snyoms par zhugs ma thag @70a *//
analyzed: // sems dpa' chen po snyoms par zhugs ma thag @70a *//
translated: As soon as the great being entered that samādhi,

original: tu 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po de thams cad dpag tshad brgya stong phrag du mar rdo rje'i rang bzhin rgya chen por lhag par gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: tu 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po de thams cad dpag tshad brgya stong phrag du mar rdo rje'i rang bzhin rgya chen por lhag par gnas par gyur to //
translated: the entire great assembly of the maṇḍala was transformed into a vast vajra expanse extending for many hundreds of thousands of yojanas.

original: der gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / dri za dang / rlung lha dang / sha za de rnams dang / mdor bsdus na sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyis brlabs kyis gzhal yas khang de rdo rje nor bu rin po che lta bur yang dag par rab tu gnas so //
analyzed: der gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / dri za dang / rlung lha dang / sha za de rnams dang / mdor bsdus na sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyis brlabs kyis gzhal yas khang de rdo rje nor bu rin po che lta bur yang dag par rab tu gnas so //
translated: There, the yakṣas, rākṣasas, gandharvas, mārutas, and piśācas, in short, the entire realm of sentient beings, by the blessing of the bodhisattva, were perfectly established in that celestial palace like a vajra jewel.

original: 'khod par gyur pa rnams phan tshun rnam par 'tshe ba med do //
analyzed: 'khod par gyur pa rnams phan tshun rnam par 'tshe ba med do //
translated: Those who were seated there were not mutually harmful.

original: de nas sems dpa' chen po de 'khor chen po 'dus par mkhyen nas /
analyzed: de nas sems dpa' chen po de 'khor chen po 'dus par mkhyen nas /
translated: Then, the great being, knowing that the great assembly had gathered,

original: khro bo'i rgyal po sgrol mas non pa la bos par gyur to //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po sgrol mas non pa la bos par gyur to //
translated: addressed the king of wrathful ones, who is trampled by Tārā:

original: kye kye khro bo chen po /
analyzed: kye kye khro bo chen po /
translated: “Kye! Kye! Great wrathful one!

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad 'dus pa 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po 'dus pa 'di'i sems can thams cad srungs shig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad 'dus pa 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po 'dus pa 'di'i sems can thams cad srungs shig /
translated: Protect all the sentient beings in this great assembly of the maṇḍala of the gathering of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas!

original: srungs shig / dbang du gyis shig /
analyzed: srungs shig / dbang du gyis shig /
translated: Protect! Control!

original: gdug pa rnams thul cig /
analyzed: gdug pa rnams thul cig /
translated: Subdue the wicked!

original: zhi ba rnams sad par gyis shig /
analyzed: zhi ba rnams sad par gyis shig /
translated: Awaken those who are peaceful!

original: ma dad pa rnams dad par gyis shig /
analyzed: ma dad pa rnams dad par gyis shig /
translated: Have faith in those who do not have faith!

original: ji srid nga'i rig sngags dang / gsang sngags spyod pa rjes su sgrub pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod rgya chen po de nyid kyi rig sngags dang / gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga 'chang ba de srid kyi bar du 'di dag gi phyi rol du song la srungs shig /
analyzed: ji srid nga'i rig sngags dang / gsang sngags spyod pa rjes su sgrub pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod rgya chen po de nyid kyi rig sngags dang / gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga 'chang ba de srid kyi bar du 'di dag gi phyi rol du song la srungs shig /
translated: As long as the vast canon of the bodhisattvas, which is the practice of the knowledge-mantra and secret-mantra, and the ritual of the maṇḍala of the practice of the knowledge-mantra and secret-mantra, remains, go outside and protect them for that long!”

original: @70b de skad ces smras pa dang / khro bo'i rgyal po chen po'i bka' mnos nas /
analyzed: @70b de skad ces smras pa dang / khro bo'i rgyal po chen po'i bka' mnos nas /
translated: When this was said, they accepted the command of the great king of wrathful ones.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba chen po'i gzugs yongs su brtags te sems can thams cad bsrung bar bya ba'i don dang / brtan par bya ba'i don du bkod pa chen po'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du khro bo'i rgyal po sgrol mas non pa khro bo brgya stong phrag du mas yongs su bskor ba phyogs bzhi kun nas de ltar steng dang /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba chen po'i gzugs yongs su brtags te sems can thams cad bsrung bar bya ba'i don dang / brtan par bya ba'i don du bkod pa chen po'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du khro bo'i rgyal po sgrol mas non pa khro bo brgya stong phrag du mas yongs su bskor ba phyogs bzhi kun nas de ltar steng dang /
translated: They assumed the form of a great transformation and were arrayed for the sake of protecting and stabilizing all beings in the great maṇḍala of the retinue. The king of wrathful ones, who is trampled by Tārā, was surrounded by many hundreds of thousands of wrathful ones. In this way, they were in all four directions, above and below.

original: 'og dang / thad kar sgra drag po 'don bzhin pas rab tu gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: 'og dang / thad kar sgra drag po 'don bzhin pas rab tu gnas par gyur to //
translated: and from the sides, with a loud sound.

original: de nas sems can de rnams zhi ba nyid kyi yid dang ldan pas yang dag par 'jug pa'i bka' las mi 'da' bar gyur te sgra 'di lta bu'ang thos par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas sems can de rnams zhi ba nyid kyi yid dang ldan pas yang dag par 'jug pa'i bka' las mi 'da' bar gyur te sgra 'di lta bu'ang thos par gyur to //
translated: Then those beings, with minds full of peace, did not transgress the command to enter, and they heard this kind of sound:

original: gang dam tshig 'di 'da' bar byed pa 'di dag ni aa rdza ka'i dog pa bzhin du mgo bo tshal pa brgyar 'gas par 'gyur te byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyis brlabs kyang de yin no //
analyzed: gang dam tshig 'di 'da' bar byed pa 'di dag ni aa rdza ka'i dog pa bzhin du mgo bo tshal pa brgyar 'gas par 'gyur te byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyis brlabs kyang de yin no //
translated: “Those who transgress this pledge will have their heads split into a hundred pieces, like an arjaka fruit, and that is the blessing of the bodhisattvas.”

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' de rang gi rig sngags dang / gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i don du chos kyi tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' de rang gi rig sngags dang / gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i don du chos kyi tshig gsungs pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva, for the sake of the practice of his knowledge-mantra and secret mantra, spoke these words of the Dharma:

original: chos gcig gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gsang sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos gcig gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gsang sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: “By one Dharma, the bodhisattva mahāsattva will accomplish the mantra.

original: gcig po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gcig po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the one?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i rnam par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'o //🔽chos gnyis po dag la rab tu gnas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @71a *//
analyzed: chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i rnam par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'o // chos gnyis po dag la rab tu gnas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @71a *//
translated: They do not see any phenomena as free from conceptual elaboration.

original: chen po'i gsang sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chen po'i gsang sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: “When bodhisattva great beings abide in two things, their secret mantra will be accomplished.

original: gnyis po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are these two?

original: byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: They are never abandoning the mind of awakening and being impartial toward all sentient beings.

original: chos gsum rnams kyi rang gi gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i don nges par brtan pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos gsum rnams kyi rang gi gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i don nges par brtan pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: “When they are firmly and completely dedicated to the meaning of the practice of their own secret mantra in three things,

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: what are these three?

original: sems can yongs su mi gtod ba nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa srung ba nyid dang / rang gi gsang sngags yongs su mi gtong ba nyid do //
analyzed: sems can yongs su mi gtod ba nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa srung ba nyid dang / rang gi gsang sngags yongs su mi gtong ba nyid do //
translated: They are never abandoning sentient beings, protecting the bodhisattva discipline, and never abandoning their own secret mantra.

original: chos bzhi yang dag par ldan na sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rig sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos bzhi yang dag par ldan na sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rig sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If one possesses four qualities, the mantra of the bodhisattva who has generated the first level of bodhicitta will be accomplished.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: rang gi gsang sngags rdzogs pa yongs su mi gtong ba nyid dang / gzhan gyi gsang sngags nye bar gcod pa min pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems nye bar gnas pa nyid dang / snying rje chen po sgom pa'i sems te chos bzhi po 'di dag dang yang dag par ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gsang sngags 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi gsang sngags rdzogs pa yongs su mi gtong ba nyid dang / gzhan gyi gsang sngags nye bar gcod pa min pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems nye bar gnas pa nyid dang / snying rje chen po sgom pa'i sems te chos bzhi po 'di dag dang yang dag par ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gsang sngags 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Not abandoning one’s own mantra, not destroying the mantras of others, maintaining a mind of love for all sentient beings, and cultivating a mind of great compassion. The bodhisattva who possesses these four qualities will accomplish the mantra.

original: chos lngas byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la yang dag par 'jug cing gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos lngas byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la yang dag par 'jug cing gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: By means of five qualities, the bodhisattva enters the canon of the bodhisattvas and will perfect the practice of mantra.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i yul bsten pa nyid @71b dang / bas mtha'i dgon pa bsten pa nyid dang / sems can gzhan la zhe sdang med pa nyid dang / 'jig rten pa'i sngags la mi lta ba nyid dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i yul bsten pa nyid @71b dang / bas mtha'i dgon pa bsten pa nyid dang / sems can gzhan la zhe sdang med pa nyid dang / 'jig rten pa'i sngags la mi lta ba nyid dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang /

analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la dad pa nye bar gcod pa med pa nyid dang / theg pa chen po'i mdo sde zab mo'i tshig gi don mi 'dor ba nyid dang / skyo ba med pa'i sems nyid kyis gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i don yongs su tshol zhing dge ba'i phyogs yongs su mi spong ba nyid de chos drug po 'di ni rig sngags kyi spyod pa dang /

analyzed: phyag rgya chen po dang / rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gtsug tor bcings te khro bo'i rtsa ba'i sngags kyis grogs bsrungs nas bdag nyid bsrung bar byas te bzlas pa byed bzhin du phyi rol du byung ste dkyil 'khor la g-yas su bskor ba byas nas kha shar du phyogs te ku sha'i khres la
translated: Having bound the uṣṇīṣa with the great seal and the root mantra, having protected the assistant with the root mantra of the wrathful one, having performed self-protection, and while reciting, having gone outside, having circumambulated the maṇḍala to the right, facing east, one should lay out the bundle of kuśa grass

translated: Here, the maṇḍala master, having performed the preliminary practices, skilled in his own knowledge, mantras, and tantras, with a strong aspiration for the Mahāyāna, should fast for one day for the sake of all beings, accompanied by good companions.

original: bstan bcos rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bya ba mthong bas tshon lnga'i phye ma zhib mo 'bar bas legs par sbyang ba byas nas rtsa ba'i rig pa'i sngags dang / snying pos mngon @87b par sngags pa'i phye ma dkyil 'khor dbus su gdab par bya'o //

translated: Having seen the various treatises, having well purified with the blazing fine powders of the five colors, one should scatter the mantra-empowered powders in the center of the maṇḍala with the root vidyā mantra and the essence mantra.

translated: Also on the other side, one should scatter in the place where the banner and flag are raised, which is adorned with four arched gates, and where the trunk of a plantain tree is laden with fruits, hanging down all around with clusters of fruits, and where the sound of a great drum,

analyzed: ngos bzhir rjes su mthun pa'i bar du bsngags pa'i sgra chos mnyan par bya'o //

analyzed: phyogs bzhi rnams su theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i glegs bam bkag par bya'o //
translated: In the four directions, one should place the volumes of the Mahāyāna sūtras.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lho phyogs su bklag par bya'o //

analyzed: mngon par bkram nas phyi rol du byung ste zhag bdun gyi bar du 'dod pa'i kha zas bsten pa gnyis sam /

translated: The rice and the very fine flour of black gram, five colors, blazing, turned into the colors white, yellow, red, black, and green, the master of the maṇḍala should take the flour that was previously placed, form the great mudrā of Bhagavatī, and seal the flour with the root vidyā.

translated: With the root essence,

translated: Then, the maṇḍala master, having contemplated the buddhas and bodhisattvas, should burn the previously mentioned incense with the vidyā.

translated: With these rites, first of all, one should draw the Blessed Buddha Śākyamuni, endowed with all supreme aspects, seated on a jeweled lion throne,

translated: The maṇḍala master should draw it everywhere, and the practitioner should perform the rite of self-protection and, having made the awareness being, offer the bali to all the spirits.

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi phyogs bzhi dang / steng dang / 'og tu gtor bar bya'o //
translated: He should scatter it outside the maṇḍala in the four directions, above, and below.

translated: Then, having bathed, he should approach the hearth, put on clean clothes, and, having performed the rite of purification and protection, he should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of ghee mixed with saffron, with the root mantra.

analyzed: de nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste de nyid du bzlas pa byed cing de nyid du gnas par bya'o //

translated: He should enchant white mustard seeds one hundred and eight times with the mantra of Tārā, the queen of obstructors.

analyzed: mngon par sngags nas kham phor kha sbyar du gzhag par bya'o //

translated: If one sees many forms of obstacles, loud noises, wind, rain, or other bad omens, or anything else, one should, being angry, offer into the fire seven oblations of white mustard seed.

analyzed: de nas bgegs rab tu 'jigs par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mi'i bgegs la ni lan lnga tshang ba nas sbyin sreg byas na skyes bu de rengs par 'gyur ba'am /

analyzed: nus pa med par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or will lose his power,

original: 'chi bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'chi bar 'gyur ba'am /

analyzed: skad cig de nyid la mi ma yin pas zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: or will be seized by a nonhuman being at that very moment.

analyzed: de nas rjes su sgrub pa pos de nyid du ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug nas khor bo'i rgyal po sgrol mas non pas bzlas pa byed cing gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then the adept should sit right there on a bundle of kuśa grass, and he should stay there reciting the mantra of Takkirāja, oppressed by Takkirāja.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i sku gzugs g-yas kyi gzhogs su rang sangs rgyas gnyis padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa skyil krung gis nye bar bzhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i sku gzugs g-yas kyi gzhogs su rang sangs rgyas gnyis padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa skyil krung gis nye bar bzhugs par bya'o //
translated: Then the maṇḍala master should place an image of Bhagavān Śākyamuni on the right side, with two pratyekabuddhas seated cross-legged on lotus seats.

analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyan thos chen po gnyis chos nyan par bya'o //

analyzed: de rnams kyi g-yas su 'ang bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: To their right, there should be Bhagavān Ārya Avalokiteśvara, adorned with all ornaments,

analyzed: padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /

analyzed: de'i yang g-yas su bcom ldan 'das ma gos dkar mo phyag na padma bsnams pa /
translated: To his right, there should be Bhagavatī Pāṇḍaravāsinī, holding a lotus,

original: phyag g-yas pas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la phyag @90a *//
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la phyag @90a *//
translated: with the right hand paying homage to Bhagavān Śākyamuni,

original: 'tshal bzhin pa padma'i gdan la nye bar bzhugs pa /
analyzed: 'tshal bzhin pa padma'i gdan la nye bar bzhugs pa /
translated: seated on a lotus seat.

original: ral pa'i cod pan 'chang ba /🔽dar la dkar po'i na bza' bsnams pa /
analyzed: ral pa'i cod pan 'chang ba / dar la dkar po'i na bza' bsnams pa /
translated: wearing a crown of hair,🔽holding a white silk garment,

original: dar la'i stod g-yogs bla gos bsnams pa /
analyzed: dar la'i stod g-yogs bla gos bsnams pa /
translated: wearing an upper garment of silk,

original: thal ba nag po'i thig le gsum byas pa'o //
analyzed: thal ba nag po'i thig le gsum byas pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du brtan pa dang / khor gnyer can ma'ang rang rang gi gdan la rang rang gi spyod lam du gnas shing nye bar bzhugs pa'ang bya'o //

analyzed: de rnams kyi g-yas su bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma dang / de bzhin gshegs pa spyan ma dang / gtsug tor rgyal mo'ang bya'o //
translated: To the right of them, one should also place Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitā, Tathāgatākṣī, and Uṣṇīṣavijayā.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug bya ba la /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'jig rten 'gro ba dang / blo gros chen po dang / mngon par 'dzin pa zhes pa ste byang chub sems dpa' chen po bcu drug po 'di rnams rab tu zhi @90b ba'i sku dang / rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa 'bri'o //
translated: Lokānuvartana, Mahāmati, and Abhinandana—these sixteen great bodhisattvas should be painted with peaceful bodies adorned with all ornaments.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po'i gtso bo dang / rig pa'i rgyal mo dang / padma'i rigs gzugs dang / phyag rgya rnams lung las ji ltar  pa bzhin dang / gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bri'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po'i gtso bo dang / rig pa'i rgyal mo dang / padma'i rigs gzugs dang / phyag rgya rnams lung las ji ltar  pa bzhin dang / gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bri'o //
translated: The chief of the kings of knowledge, the queen of knowledge, the lotus family, and the seals should be drawn according to the scriptures, in their proper places.

original: mtha'i gnas su'ang gru bzhi'i rnam par gnas bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mtha'i gnas su'ang gru bzhi'i rnam par gnas bzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the corners, one should place the four-sided [seals].

analyzed: padma'i me tog legs par byas pa dang / rig pa'i lha gang gis dran pa'ang gnas de rnams su bzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should also place there the well-formed lotus flowers and the knowledge deities that are remembered.

analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i g-yas kyi gzhogs su rang sangs rgyas nam mkha' dang / yongs su zhes bya ba gnyis kyang ngo //

original: de bzhin du shar du kha bltas pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du 'jug pa'i sgo rnams bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar du kha bltas pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du 'jug pa'i sgo rnams bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should make entrances to all the maṇḍalas facing east.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i g-yon gyi gzhogs su rang sangs rgyas tsandan dang / grub pa zhes pa gzhan gnyis kyang kun tu bri'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i g-yon gyi gzhogs su rang sangs rgyas tsandan dang / grub pa zhes pa gzhan gnyis kyang kun tu bri'o //
translated: To the left of Lord Śākyamuni, one should also draw the two other pratyekabuddhas Candana and Siddha.

original: de rnams kyi 'og tu nyan thos chen po 'od srung chen po dang / ka tya na dang gnyis kun tu bri'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'og tu nyan thos chen po 'od srung chen po dang / ka tya na dang gnyis kun tu bri'o //
translated: Below them, one should draw the two great śrāvakas Mahāmaudgalyāyana and Mahākāśyapa.

original: de rnams kyi 'ang gzhogs su 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje autpal ltar sngo bsangs su snang ba /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'ang gzhogs su 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje autpal ltar sngo bsangs su snang ba /
translated: Next to them, one should draw the noble Vajrapāṇi, appearing as blue as a lotus,

original: rab tu zhi ba'i gzugs rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /🔽phyag g-yas rnga yab thogs pa /
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i gzugs rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa / phyag g-yas rnga yab thogs pa /
translated: with a peaceful form adorned with all the ornaments,🔽holding a yak-tail fan in his right hand,

original: g-yon pa khro bo'i sbyi bor bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa khro bo'i sbyi bor bzhag pa'o //
translated: and placing his left hand on his hip.

original: rdo rje khu tshur dang / rdo rje lcags kyu dang / rdo rje lcags sgrog dang / dpung bzang dang / rdo rje sde rnams cha byad ji lta ba dang / mtshan ma ji lta @91a *//
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur dang / rdo rje lcags kyu dang / rdo rje lcags sgrog dang / dpung bzang dang / rdo rje sde rnams cha byad ji lta ba dang / mtshan ma ji lta @91a *//

analyzed: ba bzhin du bgegs rnams 'joms pa'o //

analyzed: de rnams kyi'ang g-yon du gru bzhi'i rnam par rdo rje'i phyag rgya gnyis bri bar bya'o //
translated: To the left of them, in the four corners, one should draw two vajra fists.

analyzed: bris nas kyang gnas gang du rig pa'i tshogs ma dran pa de rnams gnas 'dir bzhugs shig ces brjod par bya'o //

translated: Above them, one should draw the six perfections and Bhagavatī Māmakī, adorned with all ornaments, in a peaceful aspect.

analyzed: de rnams kyi'ang steng du gtsug tor gyi rgyal po brgyad kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khrugs pa /

analyzed: phyag rgya bcings pa rang rang gi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po chen po'i gzugs su kun tu bri ste gsar mdog dbang po rab tu zhi ba /

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with all ornaments,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs la cung zad blta ba sbyin pa rnams /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs la cung zad blta ba sbyin pa rnams /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

translated: The eight uṣṇīṣas are to be drawn: Uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin, Uṣṇīṣa Abhyudgata, Uṣṇīṣa Sitātapatra, Uṣṇīṣa Jina, Uṣṇīṣa Padma, Uṣṇīṣa Vijaya, Uṣṇīṣa Tejorāśi, and Uṣṇīṣa Urdhvaja.

analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i lus /

original: ral pa'i cod pan 'chang ba /
analyzed: ral pa'i cod pan 'chang ba /

analyzed: ral pa'i cod pan 'chang ba; phyag g-yon dbyug gu dang / ril ba spyi blugs 'dzin pa /

analyzed: phyag g-yas pas bgrang phreng bzung nas mchog sbyin pas rab tu sbyin par byed pa /

analyzed: bzhin cung zad khro gnyer can 'jug pa'i sgo la mngon par phyogs ba kun tu bri'o //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu rin po che'i gzhal yas khang /

analyzed: de la gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo chen mo /

analyzed: ha cang mi skem ha cang mi sbom pa'i lus su gnas pa /

original: rab tu zhi ba'i sku /

analyzed: gzugs mdzes shing cung zad 'dzum pa'i bzhin /

analyzed: phyag g-yon pas autpal sngon po bsnams pa /

original: phyag g-yas pas dpal 'bras bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas dpal 'bras bsnams pa /

original: byis pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: byis pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /

analyzed: padma'i gdan la nye bar bzhugs pa /

original: khro bo'i rgyal por gyur pa /
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal por gyur pa /

original: sgrol mas non pa la gzigs par gyur pa /

analyzed: lta na sdug pa thams cad du srin mo ral gcig pa byas pa'i gzugs 'chang ba kun tu bri'o //

analyzed: de'i g-yas phyogs kyi gzhogs su padma'i 'og tu khro bo'i rgyal po sgrol mas non pa bri ste /

analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba chen po'i gzugs can /

original: kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khrugs pa /
analyzed: kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khrugs pa /

analyzed: bka' so sor bzhes bzhin pa; byang chub sems dpa' chen por gyur pa la blta ba kun nas bri'o //

analyzed: g-yon gyi gzhogs su padma'i 'og tu gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i gzugs can byang chub sems dpa' lnga bri bar bya ste /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: rin po che 'bar ba du ma'i rdo'i mthil dang 'dra ba /

analyzed: kun nas 'bar ba rnam par bkra ba'i me tog rnams kyis gcal du bkram pa /

original: @92b gzugs mdzes pa kun tu bri'o //
analyzed: @92b gzugs mdzes pa kun tu bri'o //
translated: They should all be painted with beautiful forms.

original: phyi rol gyi khor yug tu gru bzhir rta babs bzhi dang ldan pa rnam par bkra ba'i tshon sna lngas gsal ba /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi khor yug tu gru bzhir rta babs bzhi dang ldan pa rnam par bkra ba'i tshon sna lngas gsal ba /

analyzed: shin tu drang ba'i mi dmar bas nang gi dkyil 'khor bya'o //
translated: One should draw the inner maṇḍala with very straight lines.

analyzed: shar gyi phyogs su bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i steng du ri mo'i dbus su me tog gi rgyal po'i dbang po /
translated: In the eastern direction, above the Blessed One Śākyamuni, in the center of the painting, one should draw the lord of flower kings,

original: padma'i gdan la nye bar bzhugs pa /
analyzed: padma'i gdan la nye bar bzhugs pa /
translated: seated on a lotus seat.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs shin tu chung tsam du bya ste kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khrugs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs shin tu chung tsam du bya ste kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khrugs pa /
translated: The form of the Tathāgata should be made very small, surrounded by a halo of blazing light.

original: phyag mchog sbyin pa rab tu sbyin pa /
analyzed: phyag mchog sbyin pa rab tu sbyin pa /
translated: He is bestowing the boon of supreme generosity.

original: sku'i gtsug tor la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i gtsug tor la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He is seated on the crown of the body.

original: de'i g-yas su gtsug tor 'khor los bsgyur ba'i phyag rgya bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i g-yas su gtsug tor 'khor los bsgyur ba'i phyag rgya bri bar bya'o //
translated: To his right, one should draw the mudrā of the uṣṇīṣa cakravartin.

original: g-yon du gzi brjid phung po'i phyag rgya bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon du gzi brjid phung po'i phyag rgya bri bar bya'o //
translated: To the left, one should draw the mudrā of Tejorāśi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan ma'i steng du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan ma'i steng du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma bri bar bya'o //
translated: Above the Tathāgata’s eyes, one should draw Prajñāpāramitā.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi steng du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i g-yas su bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi steng du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i g-yas su bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa /
translated: Above the Blessed One is Avalokiteśvara, and to the right of Prajñāpāramitā is the Blessed Amitābha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur bya ste phyag mchog sbyin pas rab tu sbyin pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur bya ste phyag mchog sbyin pas rab tu sbyin pa /
translated: He should be painted in the form of a Tathāgata, bestowing gifts with his right hand in the boon-granting gesture,

original: padma'i gdan la nye bar bzhugs pa /
analyzed: padma'i gdan la nye bar bzhugs pa /
translated: seated on a lotus seat,

original: kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: surrounded by a halo of blazing light.

original: de'i yang g-yas su lhung bzed dang / chos gos kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de'i yang g-yas su lhung bzed dang / chos gos kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: To his right are the mudrās of the alms-bowl and Dharma robe.

original: de bzhin du mthar gyis 'jug pa'i gnas su padma'i phyag rgya bya'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das me tog kun nas rgyas @93a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du mthar gyis 'jug pa'i gnas su padma'i phyag rgya bya'o // bcom ldan 'das me tog kun nas rgyas @93a *//
translated: In the same way, in the places of the gradual entry, one should draw the mudrā of a lotus.

original: pa'i rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa'i g-yon du gtsug tor gzi brjid phung po'i phyag rgya bri ste kun nas 'bar bas 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa'i g-yon du gtsug tor gzi brjid phung po'i phyag rgya bri ste kun nas 'bar bas 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: To the left of the Tathāgata Saṃkusumitarājendra, the Blessed One, one should paint the mudrā of the Uṣṇīṣa-śikhī-piṇḍī, surrounded by a halo of blazing light.

original: de'i yang g-yon du de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen tog gi sku rin po che'i ri la nye bar bzhugs pa /
analyzed: de'i yang g-yon du de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen tog gi sku rin po che'i ri la nye bar bzhugs pa /
translated: To his left, the form of Tathāgata Ratnaketu should be painted, seated on a jeweled mountain,

original: chos ston par mdzad bzhin pa /
analyzed: chos ston par mdzad bzhin pa /
translated: He is teaching the Dharma.

original: bee d'ur+ya sngon po dang / mar gad dang / padma r'a ga rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'bar ba'i 'od 'byin pa /
analyzed: bee d'ur+ya sngon po dang / mar gad dang / padma r'a ga rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'bar ba'i 'od 'byin pa /
translated: He is surrounded by a blazing light of various colors, such as blue beryl, emerald, and ruby.

original: kun nas kun tu 'od gsal ba bri'o //
analyzed: kun nas kun tu 'od gsal ba bri'o //
translated: He is completely radiant.

original: de'i yang g-yon du rgyal ba'i gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya kun nas 'bar ba 'khrugs ba kun tu bri'o //
analyzed: de'i yang g-yon du rgyal ba'i gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya kun nas 'bar ba 'khrugs ba kun tu bri'o //
translated: To his left, one should draw the mudrā of the crest of victory, blazing and turbulent on all sides.

original: de'i yang g-yon du chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya kun nas 'bar ba bri'o //
analyzed: de'i yang g-yon du chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya kun nas 'bar ba bri'o //
translated: To its left, one should draw the mudrā of the wheel of the Dharma, blazing.

original: de'i yang g-yon du ril ba spyi blugs dang / bgrang phreng dang / bzang po'i gdan gyi phyag rgya bri'o //
analyzed: de'i yang g-yon du ril ba spyi blugs dang / bgrang phreng dang / bzang po'i gdan gyi phyag rgya bri'o //
translated: To its left, one should draw the mudrā of the water jar, the rosary, and the excellent seat.

original: sgo'i gnas su rdo rje rtse gsum la gnyis ka nas kun nas 'bar bar bri'o //
analyzed: sgo'i gnas su rdo rje rtse gsum la gnyis ka nas kun nas 'bar bar bri'o //
translated: At the door locations, one should draw the three-pronged vajra, blazing on both sides.

original: bcom ldan 'das spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi 'og tu phyag rgya chen po dbyug ba can dang / autpa la'i phyag rgya kun nas 'bar ba 'di dag phan tshun ma 'byar bar kun tu bri'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi 'og tu phyag rgya chen po dbyug ba can dang / autpa la'i phyag rgya kun nas 'bar ba 'di dag phan tshun ma 'byar bar kun tu bri'o //
translated: Below Lord Avalokiteśvara, one should draw the great mudrā of Daṇḍa and the mudrā of the utpala flower, both blazing, not touching each other.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa kun tu bris pa'i phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor de'ang tshon sna lngas 'bar ba rnam par bkra zhing lta na sdug pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa kun tu bris pa'i phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor de'ang tshon sna lngas 'bar ba rnam par bkra zhing lta na sdug pa /
translated: That outer maṇḍala, which is drawn in all the forms of the maṇḍala, is blazing with the five colors, is colorful, and is beautiful to behold.

original: zur bzhis rnam par mdzes pa /
analyzed: zur bzhis rnam par mdzes pa /
translated: It is beautified with four corners.

original: rta babs bzhi'i rnam pa phyogs bzhir ro //
analyzed: rta babs bzhi'i rnam pa phyogs bzhir ro //
translated: The forms of the four entrances are in the four directions.

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor yang khru gnyis @93b tsam gyi phyi rol gyi shar phyogs su tshangs pa chen po bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor yang khru gnyis @93b tsam gyi phyi rol gyi shar phyogs su tshangs pa chen po bri bar bya ste /
translated: “Outside the inner maṇḍala, which is two cubits, one should draw Mahābrahmā in the east.

original: gdong bzhi pa /🔽gos dkar po bgos pa /
analyzed: gdong bzhi pa / gos dkar po bgos pa /
translated: He has four faces,🔽wears white garments,

original: stong g-yogs gos dkar po can /🔽mchod phyir thogs pa dkar po can gser gyi mdog ral ba'i cod pan 'chang ba /
analyzed: stong g-yogs gos dkar po can / mchod phyir thogs pa dkar po can gser gyi mdog ral ba'i cod pan 'chang ba /
translated: wears a white upper garment,🔽wears a white sacred thread, is golden colored, and has a crown of hair.

original: g-yon na dbyug pa dang / spyi blugs thogs pa /
analyzed: g-yon na dbyug pa dang / spyi blugs thogs pa /
translated: He holds a staff and a water jar in his left hand.

original: phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: He is Vajrapāṇi.

original: de'i yang g-yas su 'od gsal gyi lha'i bu bya ste lus dar la'i gos bgos pa /🔽dar la'i stod g-yogs can bzhin rab tu zhi ba /
analyzed: de'i yang g-yas su 'od gsal gyi lha'i bu bya ste lus dar la'i gos bgos pa / dar la'i stod g-yogs can bzhin rab tu zhi ba /
translated: “To his right, one should draw the son of the Ābhāsvara gods, wearing silk garments,🔽wearing a silk upper garment, with a very peaceful face,

original: ral pa'i cod pan 'chang ba /
analyzed: ral pa'i cod pan 'chang ba /
translated: and with a crown of hair.

original: mchod phyir thogs dkar po can /
analyzed: mchod phyir thogs dkar po can /
translated: He wears a white sacred thread.

original: skyil krung gis nye bar 'dug pa /
analyzed: skyil krung gis nye bar 'dug pa /
translated: He sits in the cross-legged posture.

original: phyag g-yas mchog sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas mchog sbyin pa'o //
translated: His right hand is in the boon-granting gesture.

original: de'i yang g-yas su 'og min pa'i lha'i bu bya ste rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: de'i yang g-yas su 'og min pa'i lha'i bu bya ste rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: To his right, one should paint the god of the Akaniṣṭha realm, adorned with all ornaments,

original: rab tu zhi ba'i lus /
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i lus /
translated: with a peaceful body,

original: sems bsam gtan la gnas pa /🔽dar la'i gos bgos pa /
analyzed: sems bsam gtan la gnas pa / dar la'i gos bgos pa /
translated: his mind absorbed in meditation,🔽wearing silk garments,

original: dar la'i stong g-yogs can /
analyzed: dar la'i stong g-yogs can /
translated: with a silk upper garment,

original: skyil krung gis nye bar 'dug pa /
analyzed: skyil krung gis nye bar 'dug pa /
translated: sitting in the cross-legged posture,

original: phyag g-yas pas mchog sbyin pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas mchog sbyin pa /
translated: his right hand in the boon-granting gesture,

original: mchod phyir thogs dkar po can no //
analyzed: mchod phyir thogs dkar po can no //
translated: and a white sacred thread.

original: de'i rim pas dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / 'thab 'bral dang / brgya byin la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams bri bar bya ste go rims ji lta ba bzhin dang / cha byad dang / dbyibs ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rim pas dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / 'thab 'bral dang / brgya byin la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams bri bar bya ste go rims ji lta ba bzhin dang / cha byad dang / dbyibs ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: In the same order, one should paint the gods of Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, Paranirmitavaśavartin, Yāma, Śakra, and so forth, in their respective places, with their individual forms and appearances.

original: brgya byin gyi 'og tu rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris te /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi 'og tu rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris te /
translated: Below Śakra, one should paint the Caturmahārājakāyikas.

original: rtag myos dang / phreng thogs dang / lag na gzhong thogs dang / pi wang gnyis @94a *//
analyzed: rtag myos dang / phreng thogs dang / lag na gzhong thogs dang / pi wang gnyis @94a *//
translated: (1) Mahêśvara, (2) Nandin, (3) Bhṛṅgiriṭi, (4) Caṇḍa, (5) Mahācaṇḍa, (6) Ghasmara, (7) Mahāghsma, (8) Caṇḍa-Mahāroṣaṇa, (9) Mahābala, and (10) Mahābhairava.

original: pa dang / sa bla ba'i lha'i bu rnams go rims ji lta ba dang / cha byad ji lta ba bzhin bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa dang / sa bla ba'i lha'i bu rnams go rims ji lta ba dang / cha byad ji lta ba bzhin bri bar bya'o //
translated: They should be drawn in their respective order and with their respective forms.

original: de bzhin du lho phyogs su mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong dang / gya nom snang dang / dge chung dang / bsod nams skyes la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams cha byad dang / dbyibs ji lta ba bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho phyogs su mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong dang / gya nom snang dang / dge chung dang / bsod nams skyes la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams cha byad dang / dbyibs ji lta ba bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the south, the gods of the Parīttābha, Apramāṇābha, Ābhāsvara, Parīttaśubha, Apramāṇaśubha, and Śubhakṛtsna heavens should be drawn in their respective forms and shapes.

original: de bzhin du nub kyi phyogs dang / de bzhin du'ang byang gi phyogs su'ang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du nub kyi phyogs dang / de bzhin du'ang byang gi phyogs su'ang ngo //
translated: Similarly, in the west and north.

original: nub kyi phyogs su de rnams kyi 'og tu phreng gnyis la brten nas bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: nub kyi phyogs su de rnams kyi 'og tu phreng gnyis la brten nas bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the west, below them, they should be drawn based on two garlands.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi phyi rol du dkyil 'khor gsum par 'gyur te phyogs bzhir rgyal po chen po bzhi go rims bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi phyi rol du dkyil 'khor gsum par 'gyur te phyogs bzhir rgyal po chen po bzhi go rims bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
translated: Outside the two maṇḍalas, there will be a third maṇḍala. In the four directions, the four great kings should be drawn in order.

original: byang phyogs su 'jug pa'i g-yas ngos su nor sbyin gter dang / nye bar gnas pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: byang phyogs su 'jug pa'i g-yas ngos su nor sbyin gter dang / nye bar gnas pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /

original: cod pan cung zad bcom pa /
analyzed: cod pan cung zad bcom pa /
translated: with a slightly damaged crown,

original: gnod sbyin gyi gzugs can no //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi gzugs can no //

original: de'i g-yas su nor bu bzang po dang / gang ba bzang po gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon dag bri'o //
analyzed: de'i g-yas su nor bu bzang po dang / gang ba bzang po gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon dag bri'o //
translated: To his right, one should draw the yakṣa generals Maṇibhadra and Pūrṇabhadra.

original: de bzhin du rim gyis gnod sbyin ma chen mo 'phrog ma bri ste gzhon nu dga' byed phang na 'dug pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du rim gyis gnod sbyin ma chen mo 'phrog ma bri ste gzhon nu dga' byed phang na 'dug pa /
translated: In the same way, one should draw the great yakṣiṇī Hārītī, sitting on a couch with young boys,

original: dkyil 'khor la nges par rtog bzhin pa bri'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la nges par rtog bzhin pa bri'o //
translated: gazing at the maṇḍala.

original: lngas rtsen dmar ser 'jigs su rung ba'ang bri ste /
analyzed: lngas rtsen dmar ser 'jigs su rung ba'ang bri ste /

analyzed: de rnams kyi nye logs su gnod sbyin rnams kyi phyag rgya bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du rim gyis nub kyi phyogs su lha lag @94b na zhags pa thogs pa dang / klu dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo dang / 'jog po dang / nor rgyas kyi bu la sogs pa rgyal po chen po brgyad bri bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the west, one should draw the eight great kings, such as the god in the form of a noose in his hand, and the nāgas Nanda, Upananda, Takṣaka, Vāsuki, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du phreng gnyis pa la brten nas go rims bzhin du gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / dri za dang / mi'am ci dang / lte 'phye chen po dang / drang srong dang / grub pa dang / yi dvags dang / sha za dang /

translated: Similarly, based on the second garland, one should draw in order the yakṣas, rākṣasas, gandharvas, kinnaras, mahoragas, ṛṣis, siddhas, pretas, piśācas,

original: nam mkha' lding dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa dang / sman dang / nor bu rin po che'i bye brag dang / ri bo dang / chu bo dang / gling rnams go rims bzhin du gtso bor grags pa dang /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa dang / sman dang / nor bu rin po che'i bye brag dang / ri bo dang / chu bo dang / gling rnams go rims bzhin du gtso bor grags pa dang /
translated: garuḍas, humans, non-humans, and so forth, as well as the various types of herbs, precious jewels, mountains, rivers, and islands, in order of importance.

original: mchog tu gtso bo thams cad kyang bri bar bya'o //🔽bgrang phreng lag na thogs pa /
analyzed: mchog tu gtso bo thams cad kyang bri bar bya'o // bgrang phreng lag na thogs pa /
