original: phyag na 'khor lo dang / be con dang / dung dang / ral gri thogs pa /
analyzed: phyag na 'khor lo dang / be con dang / dung dang / ral gri thogs pa /
translated: who holds a discus, a club, a conch, and a sword in his hands,

original: nam mkha' lding la bzhon pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding la bzhon pa /
translated: riding on Garuḍa,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: adorned with all ornaments.

original: gza' brgyad dang / sgyu skar nyi shu rtsa bdun dang / gangs steng gi dkyil 'khor la rab tu rgyu ba'i nye ba'i gza' brgyad kyang bri'o //
analyzed: gza' brgyad dang / sgyu skar nyi shu rtsa bdun dang / gangs steng gi dkyil 'khor la rab tu rgyu ba'i nye ba'i gza' brgyad kyang bri'o //
translated: The eight planets, the twenty-seven lunar asterisms, and the eight secondary planets that move in the sphere of the snow-clad mountains should be drawn.

original: go rim bzhin du dkar po dang / nag po'i tshes bco lnga dang / khyim bcu gnyis dang / dus drug dang / zla ba bcu gnyis dang / lo tshigs dang / sring mo bzhi gru la zhon pa dang / lnga pa ming po chu la gnas pa rnams te mdor na phyag rgya rnams su rnam par gzhag @95b par bya'o //
analyzed: go rim bzhin du dkar po dang / nag po'i tshes bco lnga dang / khyim bcu gnyis dang / dus drug dang / zla ba bcu gnyis dang / lo tshigs dang / sring mo bzhi gru la zhon pa dang / lnga pa ming po chu la gnas pa rnams te mdor na phyag rgya rnams su rnam par gzhag @95b par bya'o //
translated: The fifteen lunar days of the bright and dark fortnights, the twelve houses, the six seasons, the twelve months, the year, the four sisters riding in a boat, and the fifth brother dwelling in the water should be arranged in the seals in order.

original: lha rnams go rims bzhin du phreng gnyis su bya'o //
analyzed: lha rnams go rims bzhin du phreng gnyis su bya'o //
translated: The gods should be placed in two rows in order.

original: mdor na dkyil 'khor gsum par yang dkyil 'khor gsum la brten nas mngon par bri bar bya ste dkyil 'khor gsum po rnams su'ang gru bzhir rnam par gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na dkyil 'khor gsum par yang dkyil 'khor gsum la brten nas mngon par bri bar bya ste dkyil 'khor gsum po rnams su'ang gru bzhir rnam par gzhug par bya'o //
translated: In brief, in the third maṇḍala, one should draw the three maṇḍalas based on the three maṇḍalas, and in the three maṇḍalas, one should arrange the four corners.

original: 'di rnams bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: 'di rnams bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: These are the Blessed Ones.

original: mdor bsdus na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems dpa' thams cad kyi gtso bo ni nges par mngon par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems dpa' thams cad kyi gtso bo ni nges par mngon par bri bar bya'o //
translated: In brief, the Blessed Buddha, the chief of all the bodhisattvas, should definitely be painted.

original: padma'i rigs 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni g-yas su nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i rigs 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni g-yas su nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: Avalokiteśvara, the noble one of the Lotus family, should definitely be painted to the right.

original: rdo rje'i rigs 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje ni g-yon du nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje ni g-yon du nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: Vajrapāṇi, the noble one of the Vajra family, should definitely be painted to the left.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtso bo 'phags pa kun tu bzang po'ang nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtso bo 'phags pa kun tu bzang po'ang nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: The noble Samantabhadra, the chief of the bodhisattvas, should also definitely be painted.

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, should definitely be painted.

original: lhag ma rnams ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du phyag rgya rnams su nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du phyag rgya rnams su nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining ones should definitely be painted as the mudrās, according to their arrangement.

original: 'di dag ni nang gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nang gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the inner maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor ba la'ang shar gyi phyogs si mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba la'ang shar gyi phyogs si mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the outer maṇḍala, Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, should definitely be painted in the east.

original: de bzhin du lho'i phyogs su 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho'i phyogs su 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Similarly, in the south, Ākāśagarbha.

original: 'og min dang / gzugs can min pa rnams lha'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par ro //
analyzed: 'og min dang / gzugs can min pa rnams lha'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par ro //
translated: The Akaniṣṭha gods and the formless gods are in the form of a divine maṇḍala.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched mi gsal ba'i lha rnams ni ma yin no //🔽byang gi phyogs su brgya byin lha'i rgyal po dang / rab 'thab @96a *//
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched mi gsal ba'i lha rnams ni ma yin no // byang gi phyogs su brgya byin lha'i rgyal po dang / rab 'thab @96a *//
translated: The gods of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception are not clear.

original: bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / 'od chung la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams lha'i rgyal po re re nges par mngon par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / 'od chung la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams lha'i rgyal po re re nges par mngon par bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the northern direction, Indra, the king of the gods, and the sons of the gods Suyāma, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin, as well as the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyikas, Trāyastriṃśas, Yāma, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realms, should all be painted as kings of the gods, each one distinctly.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du phyag rgya rnams su mngon par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du phyag rgya rnams su mngon par bri bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining ones should be painted as seals, just as they are arranged.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gsum par yang byang gi phyogs su 'byung po'i bdag po dbang ldan dka' thub zlog pa dang bcas pa nges par mngon par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gsum par yang byang gi phyogs su 'byung po'i bdag po dbang ldan dka' thub zlog pa dang bcas pa nges par mngon par bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, in the third maṇḍala, in the northern direction, the lord of spirits, Īśāna, together with the ascetic Vṛtra, should definitely be painted.

original: sgo gnyis pa'i nya logs su gzhon nu smin drug gi bu rma bya'i gdan la lag na mdung thung thogs pa /
analyzed: sgo gnyis pa'i nya logs su gzhon nu smin drug gi bu rma bya'i gdan la lag na mdung thung thogs pa /
translated: On the wall of the second gate, one should draw the young Maṇibhadra, seated on a peacock, holding a spear in his hand,

original: lus dmar por snang ba /
analyzed: lus dmar por snang ba /
translated: his body appearing red,

original: gos ser po'i stod g-yogs bgos pa /
analyzed: gos ser po'i stod g-yogs bgos pa /
translated: wearing an upper garment of yellow cloth,

original: phyag g-yas na dril bu dang / ba dan dmar po thogs pa; gzhon nu'i gzugs can /
analyzed: phyag g-yas na dril bu dang / ba dan dmar po thogs pa; gzhon nu'i gzugs can /
translated: holding a bell and a red banner in his right hand, in the form of a young boy,

original: dkyil 'khor la nges par rtog bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la nges par rtog bzhin pa'o //
translated: contemplating the maṇḍala.

original: shar gyi phyogs su nam mkha' lding 'dab chags kyi gzugs can dang / drang srong m'a rkanda nges par mngon par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: shar gyi phyogs su nam mkha' lding 'dab chags kyi gzugs can dang / drang srong m'a rkanda nges par mngon par bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the east, one should draw Garuḍa in the form of a bird and the sage Mārkaṇḍa.

original: lhag ma rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du phyag rgya rnams su'ang ngo //
analyzed: lhag ma rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du phyag rgya rnams su'ang ngo //
translated: The remaining ones should be drawn as described, with their respective mudrās.

original: lho shar du gzhon nu bzhi dang / gzhon nu ming po dang lhan cig pa gru'i bzhon pa la kun tu gnas pa /
analyzed: lho shar du gzhon nu bzhi dang / gzhon nu ming po dang lhan cig pa gru'i bzhon pa la kun tu gnas pa /
translated: In the southeast, one should draw the four young boys together with their sister, seated on a boat,

original: chu gter chen po la yongs su rgyu bar byed pa /
analyzed: chu gter chen po la yongs su rgyu bar byed pa /
translated: wandering on the great ocean.

original: me lha'i rgyal po'ang nges par mngon par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: me lha'i rgyal po'ang nges par mngon par bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should also draw the king of the fire god.

original: de bzhin du lho'i phyogs su @96b lang ka'i grong gi srin po'i bdag po shin tu 'jigs su rung ba ste der shing bi tsu mrda la brten nas gnas pa dang / rmugs 'dzin chu'i dbang po zhes bya ba gnod sbyin gyi gzugs can byang chub sems dpa' nges par mngon par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho'i phyogs su @96b lang ka'i grong gi srin po'i bdag po shin tu 'jigs su rung ba ste der shing bi tsu mrda la brten nas gnas pa dang / rmugs 'dzin chu'i dbang po zhes bya ba gnod sbyin gyi gzugs can byang chub sems dpa' nges par mngon par bri bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the south, one should paint the extremely terrifying lord of rākṣasas from the city of Laṅkā, who resides there in the form of a yakṣa, and the nāga king Sāgara, who is also a bodhisattva.

original: lhag ma phyag rgya rnams su'ang rnam par bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma phyag rgya rnams su'ang rnam par bzhag par bya'o //
translated: The remaining mudrās should be arranged in the same way.

original: de bzhin du lho nub kyi phyogs su klu'i gtso bo dga' bo dang / nye dga' po nges par bri bar bya ste gza'i gtso bo nyi ma'ang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho nub kyi phyogs su klu'i gtso bo dga' bo dang / nye dga' po nges par bri bar bya ste gza'i gtso bo nyi ma'ang ngo //
translated: Similarly, in the southwest, one should paint the foremost nāgas Nanda and Upananda, and also the foremost planet, the sun.

original: nub kyi phyogs su thub pa ser skya zhes bya ba drang srong mchog dang / mu stegs can gcer bu pa'i khyu mchog gcer bu'i gzugs su go rim bzhin du phyag rgya rnams su rnam par bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: nub kyi phyogs su thub pa ser skya zhes bya ba drang srong mchog dang / mu stegs can gcer bu pa'i khyu mchog gcer bu'i gzugs su go rim bzhin du phyag rgya rnams su rnam par bzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the west, one should arrange the foremost sage Kapila, the supreme ṛṣi, and also the foremost tīrthika Nirgrantha in the form of a Nirgrantha, in the mudrās in the proper order.

original: byang nub kyi phyogs su gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po nor sbyin dang / dri za'i rgyal po zur phud lnga pa dang / mi'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pa ste 'di rnams nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang nub kyi phyogs su gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po nor sbyin dang / dri za'i rgyal po zur phud lnga pa dang / mi'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pa ste 'di rnams nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the northwest corner, the yakṣa king Dhanada, the gandharva king Pañcaśikha, and the kinnara king Druma should definitely be drawn.

original: lhag ma dbyibs ji ltar kun tu gnas pa bzhin du go rim bzhin phyag rgya rnams su'ang mngon par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dbyibs ji ltar kun tu gnas pa bzhin du go rim bzhin phyag rgya rnams su'ang mngon par bri bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining ones should be drawn in the form of their respective mudrās, in the same order as they are situated.

original: dkyil 'khor bzhi pa mngon par bri'o zhes pa phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor bzhi par ri mo lngas spras pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhi pa mngon par bri'o zhes pa phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor bzhi par ri mo lngas spras pa /
translated: “The fourth maṇḍala should be drawn” means that the outer maṇḍala should be drawn with five lines.

original: phyag rgya'i phreng bas mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i phreng bas mdzes par byas pa /
translated: It should be beautified with a garland of mudrās.

original: gru bzhi dang / rta babs bzhi'i rnam pa dang / rgyal po chen po bzhis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: gru bzhi dang / rta babs bzhi'i rnam pa dang / rgyal po chen po bzhis rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: It should have four corners and four arched gateways, and be adorned with the four great kings.

original: go rim ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa /
analyzed: go rim ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa /
translated: It should be drawn in the same order as before.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Here is how it is done:

original: 'jug pa'i skor phyag rgyar gyur pa ni autpal sngon por @97a *//
analyzed: 'jug pa'i skor phyag rgyar gyur pa ni autpal sngon por @97a *//
translated: The mudrā of the entrance is the blue utpala.

original: bri'o // g-yas dang / g-yon du ni padma dang / rdo rje dang / dgra sta dang / dung dang / mdung rtse gsum dang / be con dang / 'khor lo dang / svasti ka dang / bum pa dang / nya dang / dung dang /
analyzed: bri'o // g-yas dang / g-yon du ni padma dang / rdo rje dang / dgra sta dang / dung dang / mdung rtse gsum dang / be con dang / 'khor lo dang / svasti ka dang / bum pa dang / nya dang / dung dang /
translated: On the right and left, one should draw a lotus, a vajra, an axe, a conch, a trident, a club, a wheel, a svastika, a vase, a fish, a conch,

original: gdub kor dang / ril ba spyi blugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / zhags pa dang / dril bu dang / gri dang / tho ba dang / gzhu dang / lcags mda' ste 'di rnams rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mtshon cha'i mchog gi phyag rgyas khor yug tu grva bzhir phreng bas khyab par bya'o //
analyzed: gdub kor dang / ril ba spyi blugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / zhags pa dang / dril bu dang / gri dang / tho ba dang / gzhu dang / lcags mda' ste 'di rnams rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mtshon cha'i mchog gi phyag rgyas khor yug tu grva bzhir phreng bas khyab par bya'o //
translated: a bracelet, a water-pot, a banner, a flag, a noose, a bell, a sword, a hammer, a bow, and an iron arrow. These are the supreme mudras of various weapons. One should draw them in the four corners, surrounding the maṇḍala with garlands.

original: de nas phyi rol gyi phyogs bzhir phyag rgya chen po bzhi bzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas phyi rol gyi phyogs bzhir phyag rgya chen po bzhi bzhag par bya ste /
translated: Then, in the four directions outside, one should place the four great mudras.

original: byang phyogs su dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa'i rnam pa can byas nas rdo rje gnyis ka nas rtse mo gsum pa'i rnam pa kun nas 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs su dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa'i rnam pa can byas nas rdo rje gnyis ka nas rtse mo gsum pa'i rnam pa kun nas 'bar ba'o //
translated: In the north, one should make a square maṇḍala and draw a vajra with three prongs on each side, blazing all around.

original: shar phyogs su dkyil 'khor gru gsum pa'i rnam pa can kun nas 'bar ba can bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs su dkyil 'khor gru gsum pa'i rnam pa can kun nas 'bar ba can bzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the east, one should place a triangular maṇḍala blazing all around.

original: lho'i phyogs su dkyil 'khor gzhu'i rnam pa can byas nas lhung bzed kun nas 'bar ba can bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: lho'i phyogs su dkyil 'khor gzhu'i rnam pa can byas nas lhung bzed kun nas 'bar ba can bzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the south, one should make a bow-shaped maṇḍala and place a blazing begging bowl.

original: nub kyi phyogs su dkyil 'khor nyi ma'i rnam pa can byas nas autpal sngon po rang gi sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang ldan pa kun nas 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: nub kyi phyogs su dkyil 'khor nyi ma'i rnam pa can byas nas autpal sngon po rang gi sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang ldan pa kun nas 'bar ba'o //
translated: In the west, one should make a sun-shaped maṇḍala and place a blue utpala flower with its own stem and petals, blazing all around.

original: phyogs bral rnams su phyag rgya bzhir 'gyur ro //🔽nub byang gi phyogs su dkyil 'khor zlum po'i rnam pa can byas nas zhags pa kun nas 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs bral rnams su phyag rgya bzhir 'gyur ro // nub byang gi phyogs su dkyil 'khor zlum po'i rnam pa can byas nas zhags pa kun nas 'bar ba'o //
translated: In the intermediate directions, there are four mudrās.🔽In the northwest, one should make a round maṇḍala and place a blazing noose.

original: lho nub @97b kyi phyogs su dkyil 'khor ring po'i rnam pa byas nas dbyug pa kun nas 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: lho nub @97b kyi phyogs su dkyil 'khor ring po'i rnam pa byas nas dbyug pa kun nas 'bar ba'o //
translated: In the southwest, one should make a long maṇḍala and place a blazing club.

original: lho shar gyi phyogs su dkyil 'khor gru gsum pa'i rnam pa can byas nas dgra sta kun nas 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: lho shar gyi phyogs su dkyil 'khor gru gsum pa'i rnam pa can byas nas dgra sta kun nas 'bar ba'o //
translated: In the southeast, one should make a triangular maṇḍala and place a blazing battle-ax.

original: byang shar gyi phyogs su ral gri kun nas 'bar ba bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: byang shar gyi phyogs su ral gri kun nas 'bar ba bzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the northeast corner, one should place a blazing sword.

original: thams cad nas mngon par bris nas steng dang / 'og dang / thad dkar phyag rgya gsum phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo dang nye bar phyi ma nyid kyi bri bar bya ba la /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: thams cad nas mngon par bris nas steng dang / 'og dang / thad dkar phyag rgya gsum phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo dang nye bar phyi ma nyid kyi bri bar bya ba la / 'di lta ste /
translated: Having drawn all of this, one should draw the three mudrās of the upper, lower, and middle parts in the outer maṇḍala near the door, namely:

original: gos dang / bsil yab dang / lha ma kun nas 'bar ba de rnams mngon par bri bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: gos dang / bsil yab dang / lha ma kun nas 'bar ba de rnams mngon par bri bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: a cloth, a yak-tail fan, and a blazing maiden.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo ldan pas //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo ldan pas //
translated: The wise bodhisattva,

original: sems can phan don 'dod pa yi //
analyzed: sems can phan don 'dod pa yi //
translated: desiring the benefit and welfare of sentient beings,

original: dkyil 'khor cho ga 'di rnams kyis //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor cho ga 'di rnams kyis //
translated: with these maṇḍala rites,

original: mdor bsdus 'dir ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: mdor bsdus 'dir ni bstan pa yin //
translated: has taught this concise one here.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis dang po nyid du slob ma gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis dang po nyid du slob ma gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Then the maṇḍala master should first select the disciples.

original: dbang po mtshang ba med pa dang / yan lag thams cad mdzes pa'i bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje rigs dang / dmangs rigs byang chub tu sems bskyed pa theg pa chen po'i theg pa pa /
analyzed: dbang po mtshang ba med pa dang / yan lag thams cad mdzes pa'i bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje rigs dang / dmangs rigs byang chub tu sems bskyed pa theg pa chen po'i theg pa pa /
translated: They are Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas and Shudras who have generated the thought of enlightenment and are followers of the Mahayana.

original: theg pa gzhan mi 'dod pa'i ngang tshul can gyi sems dpa' chen po dad cing dge ba'i chos can dang / rgyal srid chen po mngon par 'dod pa dang / longs spyod chung ba la smod pa dang / longs spyod chen po mngon par 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang /🔽bzang zhing dul la tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i @98a *//
analyzed: theg pa gzhan mi 'dod pa'i ngang tshul can gyi sems dpa' chen po dad cing dge ba'i chos can dang / rgyal srid chen po mngon par 'dod pa dang / longs spyod chung ba la smod pa dang / longs spyod chen po mngon par 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / bzang zhing dul la tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i @98a *//
translated: They are bodhisattvas who have generated the mind of enlightenment, who are on the Great Vehicle, who are not interested in other vehicles, who have faith and virtuous qualities, who desire a great kingdom, who despise having few resources, who desire great wealth,

original: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma sdom pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma sdom pa la gnas pa /
translated: who are good, disciplined, and have ethical discipline, who are monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen who abide by their vows,🔽who are not interested in other vehicles, who are not interested in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas, who are not interested in the vehicles of the tīrthikas, who are not interested in the vehicles of the gods and humans, who are not interested in the vehicles of the asuras, who are not interested in the vehicles of the pretas, who are not interested in the vehicles of the animals, and who are not interested in the vehicles of the hell beings.

analyzed: de rnams kyang phan tshun kun tu chags pa /

translated: the great kings who are anointed on the crown of the head of the warrior class, and their youthful daughters who do not know the ways of the village, the Blessed One, the Great Bodhisattva Manjushri, who has the form of a youth, awakens the ignorant,

original: srog chags med pa /
analyzed: srog chags med pa /

translated: He should be one who will tread the site of unsurpassed awakening.

original: dge ba rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sangs rgyas thob par 'dod pa rnams la dkyil 'khor bstan pa nyid las sdig pa thams cad las grol bar 'gyur te mtshams med pa byed pa'i skye bo rnams kyang skad cig de la grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sangs rgyas thob par 'dod pa rnams la dkyil 'khor bstan pa nyid las sdig pa thams cad las grol bar 'gyur te mtshams med pa byed pa'i skye bo rnams kyang skad cig de la grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For those who desire to attain buddhahood through the gnosis of omniscience, all virtues are taught in the maṇḍala itself, and they will be liberated from all sins, even those who have committed the heinous acts will be liberated in that very instant.

original: de nas @101a *//
analyzed: de nas @101a *//
translated: Then,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis gos ma nyams pa tha ga pas btags ma thag pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis gos ma nyams pa tha ga pas btags ma thag pa /
translated: the maṇḍala master, with a new, undamaged cloth that has just been woven,

original: skra dang bral ba /
analyzed: skra dang bral ba /
translated: free from hair,

original: rtsa ba'i rig pas lan bdun mngon par bsngags pa /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rig pas lan bdun mngon par bsngags pa /
translated: enchanted with the root vidyā seven times,

original: dri zhim pe'i tsandan dang / gur gum gyis bgos pa'i dar gyis dkyil 'khor du 'jug par 'dod pa rnams gdong g-yogs nas thog ma nas bcom ldan 'das ma sgrub pa pos rab tu 'jug par bya'o //🔽rgyal po'i bu spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'am /
analyzed: dri zhim pe'i tsandan dang / gur gum gyis bgos pa'i dar gyis dkyil 'khor du 'jug par 'dod pa rnams gdong g-yogs nas thog ma nas bcom ldan 'das ma sgrub pa pos rab tu 'jug par bya'o // rgyal po'i bu spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'am /
translated: and wrapped in a cloth scented with sweet-smelling sandalwood and saffron, should cover the faces of those who wish to enter the maṇḍala, and first the practitioner of the Blessed Lady should enter.🔽Either a prince consecrated on the head,

original: rgyal rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: or a son of the kṣatriya caste,

original: gzhan yang spro ba chen po rgyal srid chen po 'dod pa'ang khab tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang spro ba chen po rgyal srid chen po 'dod pa'ang khab tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, those who desire the great kingdom of great delight should enter.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis par gnas pa gdong g-yogs nas dri bzang po'i me tog tsandan dang / gur gum dag gis rnam par bsres pa byin te shin tu gtsang sbra byas pa'i lag pa dag gis me tog 'thor du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis par gnas pa gdong g-yogs nas dri bzang po'i me tog tsandan dang / gur gum dag gis rnam par bsres pa byin te shin tu gtsang sbra byas pa'i lag pa dag gis me tog 'thor du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: In the second maṇḍala, having covered their faces, they should be given flowers mixed with fragrant sandalwood and saffron, and they should be made to scatter the flowers with their very clean hands.

original: gang du de'i me tog babs pa de la de'i rig pa'i sngags sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du de'i me tog babs pa de la de'i rig pa'i sngags sbyin par bya'o //
translated: To whichever deity their flower falls, that knowledge-mantra should be given to them.

original: skye ba gzhan rnams su de nyid dang / 'di rjes su 'brel ba'o zhes kun tu grags pa yin zhing de nyid 'di'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / byang chub kyi snying po gnon par byed pa dang / byang chub chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i don du mngon par sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan rnams su de nyid dang / 'di rjes su 'brel ba'o zhes kun tu grags pa yin zhing de nyid 'di'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / byang chub kyi snying po gnon par byed pa dang / byang chub chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i don du mngon par sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: In other lives, that very [deity] will be their companion, it is well known. That very [deity] will be their spiritual friend, and will accomplish the conquest of the seat of enlightenment and the complete perfection of the wisdom of omniscience of great enlightenment.

original: de nyid 'di'i bsgrub par bya ba dang / longs spyod chen @101b po dang / rgyal srid chen po dang / dbang che bar grags pa'i gang zag dang 'grogs pa 'di'i mngon par sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'di'i bsgrub par bya ba dang / longs spyod chen @101b po dang / rgyal srid chen po dang / dbang che bar grags pa'i gang zag dang 'grogs pa 'di'i mngon par sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: That very [mantra] is what is to be accomplished here, and the association with a person of great enjoyment, great sovereignty, and great power is the means of accomplishing this.

original: skye ba 'di nyid du sgrub pa gang dang ldan pa lhag par sbyod pa las las rnams thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba 'di nyid du sgrub pa gang dang ldan pa lhag par sbyod pa las las rnams thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is accomplished in this very life, endowed with that, all activities will be accomplished through practice.

original: de bzhin du rim gyis de lta bu la sogs pa ji srid brgyad po rnams de srid de gzhan rnams ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim gyis de lta bu la sogs pa ji srid brgyad po rnams de srid de gzhan rnams ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: Similarly, in order, up to that extent, such as that, up to the eight, not others.

original: sgrub bar 'dod pa gzhan yang ci ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sdig pa zad pa'i don du dam tshig tsam du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub bar 'dod pa gzhan yang ci ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sdig pa zad pa'i don du dam tshig tsam du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Also, another one who desires accomplishment, as desired, for the sake of exhausting evil, will be merely a pledge.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis mngon par dbang bskur ba sbyin na dang po re zhig dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol ha cang mi ring ha cang mi nye ba'i byang shar gyi phyogs kyi cha'i sa phyogs rtsa ba'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs shing sngags kyis dag par
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis mngon par dbang bskur ba sbyin na dang po re zhig dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol ha cang mi ring ha cang mi nye ba'i byang shar gyi phyogs kyi cha'i sa phyogs rtsa ba'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs shing sngags kyis dag par
translated: If the maṇḍala master is to bestow the actual empowerment, first, in a place that is not too far and not too near outside the maṇḍala, in the northeast, the ground should be consecrated with the root mantra and purified with the mantra.🔽Then, like a king being empowered, with a focused mind, with faith and devotion to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha,

original: byas nas de nas rgyal po mngon par dbang bskur ba de bzhin du sems bzhin pas mtha' gcig tu sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la mngon par dang ba'i dad pa dang / spro ba chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byas nas de nas rgyal po mngon par dbang bskur ba de bzhin du sems bzhin pas mtha' gcig tu sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la mngon par dang ba'i dad pa dang / spro ba chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: with great enthusiasm,

original: byang chub kyi sems dang ma bral ba /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang ma bral ba /
translated: not separated from bodhicitta,

original: theg pa chen po la zhugs pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la zhugs pa /
translated: engaged in the Mahāyāna,

original: dkon mchog gsum la bsnyen bkur byed pa /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la bsnyen bkur byed pa /
translated: honoring the Three Jewels,

original: dbang po ma tshang pa med cing ma smad pa /
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang pa med cing ma smad pa /
translated: with unimpaired and uncriticized faculties,

original: skye ba 'di nyid la rig pa dang / sngags sgrub par 'dod pa /
analyzed: skye ba 'di nyid la rig pa dang / sngags sgrub par 'dod pa /
translated: desiring to accomplish knowledge and mantra in this very life,

original: bsam pa bzang zhing sngags kyi spyod pa la spro ba'i yid dang ldan pa /🔽dge mtshan 'dod pa'i @102a *//
analyzed: bsam pa bzang zhing sngags kyi spyod pa la spro ba'i yid dang ldan pa / dge mtshan 'dod pa'i @102a *//
translated: He has a good disposition, and is enthusiastic about the practice of mantra.

original: rang bzhin can /
analyzed: rang bzhin can /
translated: He is naturally inclined to seek the auspicious.🔽He is not confused about the meaning of the knowledge [mantra] that is the cause of awakening.🔽He is attentive to that.

original: sad pa'i rgyur yang rig pa'i don la rnam rtog med cing der gtad pa'i yid can de lta bu la sogs pa lnga ji srid par mngon par dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: sad pa'i rgyur yang rig pa'i don la rnam rtog med cing der gtad pa'i yid can de lta bu la sogs pa lnga ji srid par mngon par dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: He should be consecrated as long as he has these five qualities.

original: lhag ma rnams spang bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams spang bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: The rest should be rejected.

original: shes rab can dang / spyod pa la ma rmongs pa'i khyad par las te gzhan rnams bsten par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab can dang / spyod pa la ma rmongs pa'i khyad par las te gzhan rnams bsten par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: He is wise, and is not confused about the practice.

original: de nas rgyal po thams cad dbang bskur bzhin du yo byad thams cad bsags te slob dpon dang / mkhan po mnyes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po thams cad dbang bskur bzhin du yo byad thams cad bsags te slob dpon dang / mkhan po mnyes par bya'o //
translated: Then, like a king being consecrated, he should gather all the necessary articles and please the master and the preceptor.

original: de nas bla re bres te rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang gdugs dkar po mgo bor 'dzin bzhin pa dang / rnga yab dkar po g-yob bzhin pa dang / bkur sti chen pos dung dang / rnga bo che dang / rdza rnga'i dga' ba'i sgra nges par sgrogs pa dang /
analyzed: de nas bla re bres te rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang gdugs dkar po mgo bor 'dzin bzhin pa dang / rnga yab dkar po g-yob bzhin pa dang / bkur sti chen pos dung dang / rnga bo che dang / rdza rnga'i dga' ba'i sgra nges par sgrogs pa dang /
translated: Then, having set up a canopy, holding up victory banners, flags, and white parasols over his head, waving white yak-tail fans, and proclaiming with great respect the delightful sounds of conches, bherī drums, and clay drums,🔽while being praised with the sounds of victory and auspicious verses, and with the auspicious verses spoken by the king,

original: rgyal ba'i sgra dang / bkra shis kyi tshigs su bcad pas mngon par bsngags pa dang / bde legs kyi tshigs su bcad pa rgyal pas gsungs pa rnams kyis mngon par bstod bzhin pas bskor ba dang / bkra shis de byas nas sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sgra dang / bkra shis kyi tshigs su bcad pas mngon par bsngags pa dang / bde legs kyi tshigs su bcad pa rgyal pas gsungs pa rnams kyis mngon par bstod bzhin pas bskor ba dang / bkra shis de byas nas sangs rgyas dang /
translated: having performed that auspiciousness, having paid homage to all the buddhas

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas /
translated: and bodhisattvas,

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: slob dpon / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sngags kyi spyod pa mngon par bsgrub pa la yang dag par rjes su 'jug pa dang / 'jig @102b rten pa thams cad las 'das pa'i gsang chen rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor du yang dag par rjes su 'jug pa dang /
translated: all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the practice of mantra, the attainment of the maṇḍala of liberation, the great secret that transcends all mundane [activities],🔽and the attainment of buddhahood through the entire kingdom of Dharma.

original: chos kyi rgyal srid thams cad kyis sangs rgyas nyid mngon par rtogs par 'dod pa dang / mdor bsdus nas brjod na sangs rgyas nyid 'byung ba'i phyir bdag nyid spro bar bgyi'o zhes so //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal srid thams cad kyis sangs rgyas nyid mngon par rtogs par 'dod pa dang / mdor bsdus nas brjod na sangs rgyas nyid 'byung ba'i phyir bdag nyid spro bar bgyi'o zhes so //
translated: In brief, I will inspire myself to attain buddhahood.

original: de nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste shar du mngon par phyogs pas dkyil 'khor mthong zhing rtogs pa la dang po re zhig rig pa'i mngon par dbang bskur ba byin nas phyag rgya chen po rtsa ba'i rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste shar du mngon par phyogs pas dkyil 'khor mthong zhing rtogs pa la dang po re zhig rig pa'i mngon par dbang bskur ba byin nas phyag rgya chen po rtsa ba'i rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, sitting on a bundle of kuśa grass, facing east, seeing and understanding the maṇḍala, first of all bestowing the consecration of knowledge, one should recite the root knowledge of the great seal.

original: de nas rig pa dang / sngags dag gang gnas pa /
analyzed: de nas rig pa dang / sngags dag gang gnas pa /
translated: Then, the awareness and the mantra are placed.🔽

original: gro ga'i 'dab ma la gi wang gis bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gro ga'i 'dab ma la gi wang gis bri bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the awareness and the mantra should be written on birch bark with gव्य्-juice.

original: bris nas tsandan dang / gur gum dag gis lag pa dag dang / kham phor kha sbyar bkrus nas de nas gro ga'i 'dab ma kham por kha sbyar gyi nang du bzhag par byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi nang du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhabs kyi drung du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bris nas tsandan dang / gur gum dag gis lag pa dag dang / kham phor kha sbyar bkrus nas de nas gro ga'i 'dab ma kham por kha sbyar gyi nang du bzhag par byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi nang du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhabs kyi drung du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having written it, one should wash one’s hands and a pair of joined bowls with sandalwood and saffron. Then, having placed the birch bark in the joined bowls, one should place it in the maṇḍala in front of the feet of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara.

original: de nas der nye bar 'dug ste rig pa rtsa ba'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad snga ma nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas der nye bar 'dug ste rig pa rtsa ba'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad snga ma nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, sitting there, one should recite the root awareness mantra one hundred and eight times beforehand.

original: de nas der ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug pa mngon par dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas der ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug pa mngon par dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Then, sitting on a bundle of kuśa grass there, one should be consecrated.

original: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor du thams cad dang thun mong du gyur pa'i bum pa gang ba sgo dang nye bar sngar bzhag pa blangs nas @103a *//
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor du thams cad dang thun mong du gyur pa'i bum pa gang ba sgo dang nye bar sngar bzhag pa blangs nas @103a *//
translated: In the external maṇḍala, having taken the filled vase that is common to all, which was previously placed near the door,

analyzed: slob dpon gyis rtsa ba'i rig pa bzlas shing spyi bor mngon par dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: the master, reciting the root vidyā, should confer the consecration on the head.

original: slob ma ji ltar 'dod pa'i chus spyi bo nas mngon par dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: slob ma ji ltar 'dod pa'i chus spyi bo nas mngon par dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: The disciple should be consecrated on the head with water as desired.

original: de nas de la kham phor kha sbyar de de'i ched du sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de la kham phor kha sbyar de de'i ched du sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, for him, that covered bowl should be given to him.

original: mar me la klog tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: mar me la klog tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: He should be made to recite in front of a lamp.

original: gal te des bcom ldan 'das rig pa'am /
analyzed: gal te des bcom ldan 'das rig pa'am /

analyzed: sngags bzung ba nyid yin par gyur na bklags pa nyid las kyang las byed do //

analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na rim gyis 'bad pas bsgrubs pas byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it will be done by gradually striving to accomplish it.

analyzed: gzhan rnams ni sngags bzlas pa kho nas 'grub par byed do //
translated: Others will accomplish it just by reciting the mantra.

original: de nas sngags yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sngags yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the mantra should be taken up.

original: dang po sgrub pa kho nas 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: dang po sgrub pa kho nas 'grub par byed do //
translated: One should accomplish it by means of the first [empowerment] alone.

original: zhes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa las so //
analyzed: zhes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa las so //
translated: This is stated in the Nonconceptual.

original: de kho na sngar bris pa slob dpon gyi sgrub pa gsum gyis nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na sngar bris pa slob dpon gyi sgrub pa gsum gyis nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is as previously written. One will certainly accomplish it by means of the three [types of] practice of the master.

original: 'bad pa med par ro //
analyzed: 'bad pa med par ro //
translated: Without effort.

original: de bzhin du thog mar rig pa'i mngon par dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thog mar rig pa'i mngon par dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should first bestow the consecration of knowledge.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis par mngon par dbang bskur pa ni /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis par mngon par dbang bskur pa ni /
translated: The consecration in the second maṇḍala is as follows.

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis par dkyil 'khor thams cad la dang / lha thams cad la gang rab tu bstabs pa'i bum pa gang ba des snga ma'i cho ga gang yin pa ji lta ba de nyid kyis spyi bor mngon par dbang bskur bar byas na sdig pa thams cad las grol @103b bar 'gyur te sangs rgyas thams cad kyis
translated: In the second maṇḍala, with the vase that is filled and offered to all maṇḍalas and all deities, one should consecrate the head with that very rite as before. One will be freed from all sins and will be

original: rjes su gnang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su gnang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: authorized by all buddhas.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi dam tshig dang / dkyil 'khor dang / sngags dang / phyag rgya sgrub pa la'ang lhag par 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi dam tshig dang / dkyil 'khor dang / sngags dang / phyag rgya sgrub pa la'ang lhag par 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be especially devoted to all the commitments, mandalas, mantras, and practices of the supramundane.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis slob dpon du mngon par dbang bskur ba sbyin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis slob dpon du mngon par dbang bskur ba sbyin no //
translated: All the bodhisattvas will bestow the consecration as a master.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum par nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la phul ba'i bum pa gang ba cho ga de nyid kyis spyi bor mngon par dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum par nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la phul ba'i bum pa gang ba cho ga de nyid kyis spyi bor mngon par dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: In the third mandala, all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas should be offered the vase filled with water. With that very ritual, the consecration on the crown should be performed.

analyzed: khyod la sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa thams cad kyis 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi rig pa'i sngags rnams dang / dkyil 'khor 'dri ba dang / nye bar ston pa dang / rgyud dang /
translated: “All the buddhas and bodhisattvas endowed with great magical power will bestow upon you all the mundane and supramundane knowledge-mantras, the drawing of the maṇḍala, the teaching, the tantra,

analyzed: rgyud kyi phyag rgya dang / spyad pa nges par ston pa dang / rang gi cho ga nges par ston par rjes su gnang ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The seal of the tantra, the teaching of the practice, and the teaching of one's own rite are permitted.

original: skye ba 'di nyid dam /
analyzed: skye ba 'di nyid dam /
translated: In this very life, or

original: gang phyi ma gzhan dang / gzhan rnams su sangs rgyas nyid nges par thob bo //
analyzed: gang phyi ma gzhan dang / gzhan rnams su sangs rgyas nyid nges par thob bo //
translated: in the next or other future lives, Buddhahood is definitely attained.

original: de bzhin du rgyal ba dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i mngon par dbang bskur ba dang / sngar nges par bstan pa'i cho gas bcom ldan 'das la sngar phul ba'i bum pa gang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' la phul ba'i bum pa gang bas de bzhin kho nar mngon par dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal ba dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i mngon par dbang bskur ba dang / sngar nges par bstan pa'i cho gas bcom ldan 'das la sngar phul ba'i bum pa gang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' la phul ba'i bum pa gang bas de bzhin kho nar mngon par dbang bskur ro //
translated: In the same way, with the victorious and completely victorious consecrations, with the previously taught rite, with the full vase offered to the Blessed One and the full vase offered to the Bodhisattva, one should consecrate in the same way.

original: de @104a *// bzhin du'ang khyod la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos rnams kyis 'byung po thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa dang / lus can thams cad kyis mi thub cing rnam par rgyal ba dang /
analyzed: de @104a *// bzhin du'ang khyod la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos rnams kyis 'byung po thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa dang / lus can thams cad kyis mi thub cing rnam par rgyal ba dang /
translated: In the same way, the Blessed Buddhas, the great bodhisattvas, and the śrāvakas give their permission to you, saying, ‘May all beings not be overcome by spirits, and may all embodied beings be invincible and victorious.

original: khyod sngags thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sgrubs shig ces rjes su gnang ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod sngags thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sgrubs shig ces rjes su gnang ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Practice all the mantras as you wish.’

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis sems can lnga po nyid re re la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du mngon par dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis sems can lnga po nyid re re la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du mngon par dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then the maṇḍala master should give the consecration to each of the five beings as they wish.

original: de nas de dag rim gyis dkyil 'khor du bcug nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phul te dkyil 'khor la bskor ba lan gsum byas nas gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de dag rim gyis dkyil 'khor du bcug nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phul te dkyil 'khor la bskor ba lan gsum byas nas gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having gradually brought them into the maṇḍala, having offered them to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, having circumambulated the maṇḍala three times, one should request them to depart.

original: de nas nyi ma gzhan la rim gyis rig pa dang / gsang sngags kyi spyod pa rnams la bslab par bya zhing rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma gzhan la rim gyis rig pa dang / gsang sngags kyi spyod pa rnams la bslab par bya zhing rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Then, on another day, one should gradually train in the conduct of the awareness and mantra, and apply it.

original: skad cig de nyid la song nas sngar brten par phul ba byang chub sems dpa' chen po la sngar phul ba'i chu bum pa gang ba blangs nas dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa de rnams la chu khyor pa gsum shar du mngon par phyogs par byas nas 'thung du
analyzed: skad cig de nyid la song nas sngar brten par phul ba byang chub sems dpa' chen po la sngar phul ba'i chu bum pa gang ba blangs nas dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa de rnams la chu khyor pa gsum shar du mngon par phyogs par byas nas 'thung du
translated: Having gone to that very place, one should take the full water pot previously offered to the great bodhisattva and, having entered the maṇḍala, cause those who have entered to drink three handfuls of water, facing east.

original: gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should cause them to drink.

original: 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
translated: One should say this:

original: kye byang chub sems dpa' chen po /
analyzed: kye byang chub sems dpa' chen po /
translated: “O great bodhisattva!

original: gsang ba'i @104b dam tshig gang gis 'da' bar byed pa bsod nams ma yin pa mang po skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsang ba'i @104b dam tshig gang gis 'da' bar byed pa bsod nams ma yin pa mang po skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one transgresses the secret pledge, much demerit will arise.

original: dkyil 'khor gang du'am /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gang du'am /
translated: In which maṇḍala?

original: der yang rigs dman pa gang gis dkyil 'khor du 'ongs pa de rnams kyang dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis snying rje chen po'i sems bskyed nas grogs byed pa'i lag par gos dkar po gtsang ma mgo bor bcings pa gzhan gyis sam /
analyzed: der yang rigs dman pa gang gis dkyil 'khor du 'ongs pa de rnams kyang dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis snying rje chen po'i sems bskyed nas grogs byed pa'i lag par gos dkar po gtsang ma mgo bor bcings pa gzhan gyis sam /
translated: If there are any of the lower castes who have come to the maṇḍala, the maṇḍala master should generate the mind of great compassion and, having bound a pure white cloth on the hand of the helper,

original: gos kun tu g-yogs te gnas pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas rigs dman pa rnams kyis me tog gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: gos kun tu g-yogs te gnas pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas rigs dman pa rnams kyis me tog gtor bar bya'o //
translated: he should scatter flowers with the lower castes, having covered them with cloth and formed the samaya mudra.

original: de nas grogs byed pa de rnams kyis kyang rab tu zhugs pa'i sems can thams cad kyis khrus bya'o //
analyzed: de nas grogs byed pa de rnams kyis kyang rab tu zhugs pa'i sems can thams cad kyis khrus bya'o //
translated: Then, those helpers should bathe all the sentient beings who have entered.

original: de rnams kyis kyang dam tshig tsam de 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang dam tshig tsam de 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also become samaya-born.

original: sgrub pa'ang grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'ang grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also accomplish the practice.

original: de sngar byas pa'i me'i bya ba'i gnas su song nas rtse mo ma nyams pa'i ku sha rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de sngar byas pa'i me'i bya ba'i gnas su song nas rtse mo ma nyams pa'i ku sha rnams kyis so //
translated: Having gone to the place where the fire ritual was previously performed, they should do it with undamaged kuśa grass.

original: der yang me thab rnam pa gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: der yang me thab rnam pa gsum du brjod do //
translated: There, the hearth is said to be of three types.

original: zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / mngon spyod do //
analyzed: zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / mngon spyod do //
translated: (They are) pacifying, enriching, and violent.

original: zhi ba'i don du padma'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i don du padma'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For the sake of pacifying, (the shape is) that of a lotus.

original: yang na tshim par byed pas dbang du byed pa'ang ngo //
analyzed: yang na tshim par byed pas dbang du byed pa'ang ngo //
translated: Or else, (it is) a triangle, because it satisfies and brings under control.

original: mngon spyod la zur gsum mo //
analyzed: mngon spyod la zur gsum mo //
translated: For violent (rites, the shape is) a triangle.

original: de la me'i bya ba'i cho ga thams cad la ku sha dgram par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la me'i bya ba'i cho ga thams cad la ku sha dgram par 'gyur ro //
translated: In all rites of fire, one should spread kuśa grass.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag bya ba byas nas shar gyi rtse mor me'i bya ba bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag bya ba byas nas shar gyi rtse mor me'i bya ba bzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having made obeisance to all the Buddhas, one should place the fire for the rite in the eastern peak.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyi nas me'i bya ba mdzad pa rnams la phyag byas nas lho'i rtse @105a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyi nas me'i bya ba mdzad pa rnams la phyag byas nas lho'i rtse @105a *//
translated: Having made obeisance to the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, who perform the rites of fire afterwards, (one should place the fire) in the southern peak.

original: mor ro // byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas byang gi rtse mor sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: mor ro // byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas byang gi rtse mor sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having made obeisance to all the Bodhisattvas, (one should place the fire) in the northern peak.

original: de bzhin du'ang bya ba rnams grogs byed pas gnas pa'i ngang tshul can gyis me'i bya ba ku sha rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du'ang bya ba rnams grogs byed pas gnas pa'i ngang tshul can gyis me'i bya ba ku sha rnams kyis so //
translated: Thus, (the fire) should be placed by one who is of a settled disposition, because (he) assists the rites.

original: thog mar rtsa ba'i rig pas so //
analyzed: thog mar rtsa ba'i rig pas so //
translated: (The fire) should be placed with the root vidyā.

original: thog mar zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar la btags pa'i 'bras yos kyi sbyin sreg nyi shu rtsa gcig sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: thog mar zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar la btags pa'i 'bras yos kyi sbyin sreg nyi shu rtsa gcig sbyin par bya'o //
translated: First, one should offer twenty-one oblations of parched rice mixed with curd, honey, and ghee.

original: zhi ba'i don du snying pos mar gyis so //
analyzed: zhi ba'i don du snying pos mar gyis so //
translated: For the purpose of pacifying, with the essence [mantra] and ghee.

original: rgyas pa'i don du shing aa pa marga gsum gyi sbyin sreg 'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i don du shing aa pa marga gsum gyi sbyin sreg 'o //
translated: For the purpose of enriching, with the oblation of the three kinds of wood.

original: mngon spyod la ka ta ke yis so //
analyzed: mngon spyod la ka ta ke yis so //
translated: For the purpose of assault, with the kataka.

original: me'i bya ba'i cho ga 'di 'ang thams cad du thun mong ba'i sgrub pa rnams la'ang ngo //
analyzed: me'i bya ba'i cho ga 'di 'ang thams cad du thun mong ba'i sgrub pa rnams la'ang ngo //
translated: This rite of fire is also for all the common sādhanas.

original: dkyil 'khor sems cad kyi nye bar spyod pa rnams su'ang ngo //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor sems cad kyi nye bar spyod pa rnams su'ang ngo //
translated: It is also for the enjoyments of the maṇḍala beings.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyi gnas gtsang mas gtso bo'i lha nyid bstan nas me'i cho ga'i bya ba byas te 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyi gnas gtsang mas gtso bo'i lha nyid bstan nas me'i cho ga'i bya ba byas te 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, the maṇḍala master, having shown the principal deity himself in a pure place, having performed the rite of fire, should say this:

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad du rab tu zhugs pa rnams la de nas rtsa ba'i rig pa bzlas pas mchod yon no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad du rab tu zhugs pa rnams la de nas rtsa ba'i rig pa bzlas pas mchod yon no //
translated: To those who have entered all maṇḍalas, then, with the recitation of the root vidyā, the welcome offering.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / gzhan yang /
translated: the bodhisattvas, and🔽also the special gods of great magic,

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po'i lha'i khyad par rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams kyang gsan du gsol /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po'i lha'i khyad par rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams kyang gsan du gsol /
translated: and the blessed śrāvakas, please listen!

original: yang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor 'dir cho ga las 'das par yang rung ste gus par byed pa dang / @105b gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor 'dir cho ga las 'das par yang rung ste gus par byed pa dang / @105b gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover, in this maṇḍala of samaya, even those who transgress the rite, or who are disrespectful,

original: gang cung zad bdag nyid nyams par bya ba de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis dkyil 'khor thams cad rab tu gnas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod yul dang ma bral bar thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: gang cung zad bdag nyid nyams par bya ba de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis dkyil 'khor thams cad rab tu gnas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod yul dang ma bral bar thob par gyur cig /
translated: and whatever else may be a downfall for oneself, by this root of virtue, may they attain the complete consecration of all maṇḍalas, and may they not be separated from the domain of all tathāgatas and the domain of all bodhisattvas.

original: myur du bde ba dang ldan pa thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: myur du bde ba dang ldan pa thob par gyur cig /
translated: May they quickly attain happiness.

original: de skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say this.

original: dkyil 'khor du rab tu zhugs pa'i sems can rnams thams cad la mdor na byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du rab tu zhugs pa'i sems can rnams thams cad la mdor na byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: In short, all beings who have entered the maṇḍala should be inseparable from the mind of awakening.

original: sbyin pa la rab tu chags pa dang / byams pa la sogs pa la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mchod pa dang / mdor na lung dang / rig pa dang / gsang sngags sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpas gsungs pa rnams blta bar bya /
analyzed: sbyin pa la rab tu chags pa dang / byams pa la sogs pa la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mchod pa dang / mdor na lung dang / rig pa dang / gsang sngags sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpas gsungs pa rnams blta bar bya /
translated: They should be devoted to generosity, abide in loving kindness, and so forth, make offerings to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and in short, they should study the scriptures, the tantras, and the secret mantras taught by the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: They should be inseparable from the mind of awakening.”

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa de rnams thams cad la dri bzang po'i me tog gis mchod yon phul nas sam /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa de rnams thams cad la dri bzang po'i me tog gis mchod yon phul nas sam /
translated: Then the maṇḍala master should offer a welcome gift of flowers and fragrant water to all those bodhisattvas and so forth,

original: de nas yid kyis mchod yon phul nas rtsa ba'i rig pa bzlas pas gatstsha gatstsha zhes pa dang / sv'ah'a zhes pa kho na bzlas pas phyogs bzhir rnam par bltas te bcom ldan 'das ma'i rtsa ba'i phyag rgya bcings nas gyen du nges par bltas pas gshegs @106a *//
analyzed: de nas yid kyis mchod yon phul nas rtsa ba'i rig pa bzlas pas gatstsha gatstsha zhes pa dang / sv'ah'a zhes pa kho na bzlas pas phyogs bzhir rnam par bltas te bcom ldan 'das ma'i rtsa ba'i phyag rgya bcings nas gyen du nges par bltas pas gshegs @106a *//
translated: Having recited this, one should look in the four directions, form the root mudrā of the Blessed Lady, and look upward.

analyzed: su gsol bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should request her to depart.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod bcom ldan 'das ma 'phags ma sgrol ma ral pa gyen pa rdzes kyi rtsa ba'i cho ga las dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga rab 'byams kyi le'u ste gnyis pa rdzogs so ////

translated: This concludes the second chapter, the chapter on the maṇḍala rite from the Root Tantra of Noble Tārā, Upholding the Promise, from the Basket of the Bodhisattva.

translated: Then, that great being, having again looked at the entire assembly, spoke to all the sons of the gods:

analyzed: khyed rnams nyon cig /
translated: “Listen, all of you!

original: don thams cad sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: don thams cad sgrub par byed pa /

translated: the all-auspicious, the supremely auspicious,

analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa /
translated: the teaching of all buddhas,

original: bdag gi mchog tu gsang ba'i snying po yang dag par gyur pa /
analyzed: bdag gi mchog tu gsang ba'i snying po yang dag par gyur pa /

analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels.

analyzed: na mo a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /

analyzed: mah'a ka ru ni k'a ya /

analyzed: tadya th'a / t'a re tutt'a re tu re sv'ah'a /
translated: Tadyathā: tāre tuttāre ture svāhā.

analyzed: 'di ni 'phags @106b ma sgrol ma las chen po thams cad byed pa las phran tshegs thams cad bklags pas grub pa /

analyzed: mchog tu gsang ba shin tu gsang ba /

translated: and it destroys all the activities of others’ rites. This knowledge is also the rite of the second maṇḍala and the means of accomplishment. The noble Tārā has condensed all the great activities and applied them to all minor activities, and it should be used in all the maṇḍala rites

original: sgrub thabs rnams la'ang ngo //
analyzed: sgrub thabs rnams la'ang ngo //
translated: and means of accomplishment.🔽Whenever,

original: nyin mtshan gang du'am /
analyzed: nyin mtshan gang du'am /

analyzed: der yang rung ste gtsang ma'i phyogs su bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: bdag nyid nyes pa med pa dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis gcig pus dang po re zhig gru bzhi mnyam pa /

analyzed: sgo bzhi pa /
